channel.title: NFL: Good Morning Football
channel.description: The best morning show on sports television is now a daily podcast. GMFB sets the narrative and agenda for everything from the NFL Draft to Training Camp to Kickoff. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Peter Schrager, Kyle Brandt and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty are talking all things football 12 months a year on GMFB. Be sure to catch Good Morning Football on NFL Network weekdays at 7:00 AM ET.

item.title: Friday Pt 2: Perfect season? Rams/Bucs Preview, Nate Burleson, Week 9 Matchups, and Pickle Picks!
item.itunes:title: Friday Pt 2: Perfect season? Rams/Bucs Preview, Nate Burleson, Week 9 Matchups, and Pickle Picks!
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the chances of an undefeated season for the Eagles.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champions Jason McCourty and Shaun O'Hara discuss the 2021 playoff teams that need a win the most this weekend.  Nate Burleson drops by with excitement around the Eagles and gives his favorite NFL Trade that happened at the Deadline.  The table continues to explore some of the best Week 9 matchups before we wrap up the week with Pickle Picks!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Friday Pt 1: Eagles still undefeated, Week 9 Matchups, Aaron Rodgers disrespected? Spotlight players, and Titans/Chiefs Preview
item.itunes:title: Friday Pt 1: Eagles still undefeated, Week 9 Matchups, Aaron Rodgers disrespected? Spotlight players, and Titans/Chiefs Preview
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Eagles win over the Texans to remain undefeated.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champions Jason McCourty and Shaun O'Hara examine the long drives Philly uses to eliminate any momentum from their opponents. The table looks at some of the best Week 9 matchups before asking if Aaron Rodgers has been disrespected by the Packers.   We look at the teams or players that will be in the spotlight this weekend then wrap up with a preview of Titans/Chiefs coming on Sunday Night!

Stay tuned for Nate Burleson and more picks for Week 9 coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: El Huddle: Winners and Losers of the Trade Deadline, and talking Raiders, Comedy, and Identity with Anjelah Johnson-Reyes
item.itunes:title: El Huddle: Winners and Losers of the Trade Deadline, and talking Raiders, Comedy, and Identity with Anjelah Johnson-Reyes
item.description:
Will Selva and MJ Acosta-Ruiz discuss who made the most (and least) noise at the Trade Deadline and how the new players might impact week 9. Then they’re joined by comedian, actress, and author Anjelah Johnson-Reyes to talk about her time as a Raiderette, her road into comedy, and her journey defining her identity.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Thursday Pt2: Eagles-Texans preview; Has Daniel Jones done enough? Andrew Whitworth
item.itunes:title: Thursday Pt2: Eagles-Texans preview; Has Daniel Jones done enough? Andrew Whitworth
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Jamie Erdahl, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champions Jason McCourty and Shaun O’Hara previewing the matchup between the Philadelphia Eagles and Houston Texans on Thursday Night Football. Andrew Whitworth stop by and shares how the Eagles can avoid overlooking the Texans, and then he weighs in on the Rams and Buccaneers struggles. Part two of the GMFB podcast finishes up discussing if Daniel Jones has done enough to be deemed “The Guy” in New York.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Thursday Pt1: How can Eagles become NFL's best? Bradley Chubb's extension; Best offseason acquisition? Patriots LB Matt Judon
item.itunes:title: Thursday Pt1: How can Eagles become NFL's best? Bradley Chubb's extension; Best offseason acquisition? Patriots LB Matt Judon
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Jamie Erdahl, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champions Jason McCourty and Shaun O’Hara looking at how the Philadelphia Eagles can solidify themselves as the best team in the NFL. With A.J. Brown’s dominance this season, everyone answers which player was the best offseason acquisition for their team and then they share which matchup this weekend is an under-the-radar thriller. Part one of the GMFB podcast finishes up reacting to Bradley Chubb’s extension with the Dolphins and then they’re joined by Patriots linebacker Matthew Judon and he talks about how the Patriots can make a run at the playoffs and what it’s like being coached by Bill Belichick.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Wednesday Pt2: No deals for Packers, Fabulous Five, 2x SB Champ Chris Long, and Giants LB Tae Crowder
item.itunes:title: Wednesday Pt2: No deals for Packers, Fabulous Five, 2x SB Champ Chris Long, and Giants LB Tae Crowder
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Packers not making a deal before the trade dealine. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss how the NFC North fared in deals. We get Schrager's Fabulous Five rookies before 2x Super Bowl Champ Chris Long drops by to discuss the undefeated Eagles. Chris expects great play out of guys like Tom Brady and Aaron Rodgers when their backs are against the wall.  We wrap up with Giants LB Tae Crowder at the table to take us inside the NY locker room and HC Brian Daboll's first year.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Wednesday Pt1: Trade Deadline Deals, Dangerous teams, and WR Terry McLaurin
item.itunes:title: Wednesday Pt1: Trade Deadline Deals, Dangerous teams, and WR Terry McLaurin
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with a record 12 players being traded before the NFL deadline. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss the Dolphins making the biggest wave acquiring LB Bradley Chubb. The Vikings, Bears, and Jaguars also caught the eyes of our experts.  We discuss the dangerous teams that no one wants to play right now before Jason reveals what it's like for players that were on the trading block but didn't get dealt. Kyle thinks the Vikings are about to go on a run and can't wait to see them face the Bills in two weeks.  Plus, Commanders WR Terry McLaurin on the team's 3 game win streak and facing the Vikings on Sunday.

Stay tuned for Chris Long and Schrager's Fabulous Five coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: The Season with Peter Schrager: Giants GM Joe Schoen, Geno Smith’s Unbelievable Season, Tua and the Dolphins, and a Deep Dive into the DJ Moore Helmet Removal Penalty
item.itunes:title: The Season with Peter Schrager: Giants GM Joe Schoen, Geno Smith’s Unbelievable Season, Tua and the Dolphins, and a Deep Dive into the DJ Moore Helmet Removal Penalty
item.description:
NFL Network’s Peter Schrager is joined by New York Giants’ 1st year General Manager Joe Schoen, who reflects on this year’s red hot start to the Giants season, goes into his path from ticket office intern to NFL GM, and takes us into the Bills Draft Room on the day Josh Allen was selected. Peter also highlights the contributions of two quarterbacks who have taken the league by surprise this season, and discusses whether the DJ Moore helmet removal flag should have been a penalty or not. Finally, NFL Network ace researcher Tony Holzman-Escareno joins Peter to highlight how unique Christian McCaffrey’s day was against the Rams, and Peter’s friend Aaron reveals his scorching hot take on the Instagram-ization of Halloween. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Tuesday Pt2: NFL Trade Deadline, Tua Improving, Jets TE CJ Uzomah, and Power Rankings
item.itunes:title: Tuesday Pt2: NFL Trade Deadline, Tua Improving, Jets TE CJ Uzomah, and Power Rankings
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the NFL Trade Deadline looming at 4pm ET.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty all give teams they want to see making deals.  Jason asks if Tua Tagovailoa has reached the point of being considered a top tier QB.  Jets TE CJ Uzomah stops by with the NFL's Salute to Service along with the team's recent loss to the Patriots.  The table looks at the latest NFL Power Rankings with Dan Hanzus as the Bills, Eagles, and Chiefs are the top three teams.  

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Tuesday Pt1: Browns dominate, NFL Trade Deadline, Ravens real? and Scott Pioli
item.itunes:title: Tuesday Pt1: Browns dominate, NFL Trade Deadline, Ravens real? and Scott Pioli
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Browns dominating win over the Bengals.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss the play of Jacoby Brissett with the looming return of Deshaun Watson.  We update possible moves to look for leading up to the NFL Trade Deadline including Roquan Smith being traded to the Ravens.  The table debates Baltimore as a threat in the AFC before Fmr NFL Exec Scott Pioli drops by to explain the thought process of GM's considering trades.  Plus, we discuss the success Pete Carroll is having with Geno Smith and the Seahawks.

Stay tuned for Jets TE CJ Uzomah and NFL Power Rankings coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Friday Pt2: 49ers/Rams, Nate Burleson, GMFB Jam, Ja'Marr Chase update, Joe Haden and Pickle Picks
item.itunes:title: Friday Pt2: 49ers/Rams, Nate Burleson, GMFB Jam, Ja'Marr Chase update, Joe Haden and Pickle Picks
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with a preview of the Rams hosting the 49ers. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara discuss both of these teams trying to get their seasons straightened out.  Nate Burleson drops by to explain that he loves Tom Brady but thinks he should've stayed retired.  After a quick look at RB/WR combos for GMFB Jam, Fmr NFL CB Joe Haden tells the table how he almost ended up with the Bills or Rams but ultimately decided to end his football career.  The drama around the Cardinals is picking up just in time for the debut of the in-season Hard Knocks.  We wrap up with Pickle Picks for NFL Week 8.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Friday Pt1: Ravens beat Bucs, Best Week 8 Games, Packers-Bills Preview, and Bills Safety Jordan Poyer
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Ravens victory over the Buccaneers.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara discuss Tom Brady's comments and how we're in unchartered territory with the QB. While looking at the best Week 8 games, we look for the difference-maker in Packers/Bills.  Plus, Buffalo Safety Jordan Poyer drops by to discuss facing Aaron Rodgers and what Von Miller has brought to the Bills defense. 

Stay tuned for Nate Burleson and a 49ers/Rams preview coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: El Huddle: Trade Deadline, Spooky QB Situations, and Halloween Costumes
item.itunes:title: El Huddle: Trade Deadline, Spooky QB Situations, and Halloween Costumes
item.description:
Will Selva and MJ Acosta-Ruiz look forward to the Trade Deadline, the most exciting games of Week 8, and how they’re spending Halloween. They break down the CMC trade and the roster construction arms race involving the league’s top teams. Next, Will and MJ discuss the flurry of news surrounding quarterbacks, including Mac Jones, Matt Ryan, and Aaron Rodgers, before Will shares a few running backs he expects to have a major impact this weekend, and MJ highlights Joe Burrow and the Bengals.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Wednesday Pt2: Bills HC Sean McDermott, Brittney Griner Update, Giants/Seahawks, and Fmr NFL DE Jared Allen
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with Packers/Bills on Sunday Night. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty welcome Bills HC Sean McDermott to the show to discuss coming off the bye week to face Aaron Rodgers and his favorite movie, Vision Quest.  Jamie doesn't want the sports world to forget the plight of Brittney Griner in Russia.  The Seahawks host the Giants this week, but which team has been more impressive? Plus, we're joined by Fmr NFL DE Jared Allen who weighs in on the Vikings quiet 5-1 start.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: The Season with Peter Schrager: Buffalo Bills OC Ken Dorsey Stops By, Peter’s Saturday with the McVays in LA, Thoughts on Seattle’s Amazing 2022 Draft Class, and Daniel Jones’ Future in New York
item.itunes:title: The Season with Peter Schrager: Buffalo Bills OC Ken Dorsey Stops By, Peter’s Saturday with the McVays in LA, Thoughts on Seattle’s Amazing 2022 Draft Class, and Daniel Jones’ Future in New York
item.description:
NFL Network’s Peter Schrager is joined by Buffalo Bills Offensive Coordinator Ken Dorsey, who shares when he knew Josh Allen was something special, how he feel when he watches Josh hurdle defenders, and stories from his time as a star college quarterback at University of Miami. Peter also shares the story of his weekend with Sean McVay binge watching HBO, who should get the credit for the revitalized Seattle Seahawks, and what REALLY happened on the Browns’ last play. Finally, NFL Researcher Tony Holzman-Escareno joins Peter to break down Brady’s early season struggles, and Peter’s friend Noah responds to Paul Rudd’s shout out from last week’s episode.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Tuesday Pt2: Biggest threat to Eagles in NFC East; Power Rankings; The Life and Myth of Bo Jackson
item.itunes:title: Tuesday Pt2: Biggest threat to Eagles in NFC East; Power Rankings; The Life and Myth of Bo Jackson
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty examining which team in the NFC East will give the Philadelphia Eagles the biggest problems. Dan Hanzus joins the GMFB podcast to deliver his latest Power Rankings and then Scott Pioli drops by and talks about the Patriots QB situation, Tom Brady’s struggles and Daniel Jones’ future with the Giants. Part two of the GMFB podcast finishes up being joined by author Jeff Pearlman who wrote: “The Last Folk Hero: The Life and Myth of Bo Jackson"

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Tuesday Pt1: Bears impressive win; Patriots QB plan; Can Jets keep winning?
item.itunes:title: Tuesday Pt1: Bears impressive win; Patriots QB plan; Can Jets keep winning?
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty looking at what impressed them the most about the Chicago Bears victory on Monday Night Football against the New England Patriots. Next, they react to the confusing Patriots plan at quarterback with Bailey Zappe and Mac Jones getting starter reps and then part one of the GMFB podcast finishes up discussing the Jets acquiring James Robinson after losing Breece Hall for the season.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Bo Brandt with Bonnetta: Week 7 Recap (with Kyle Brandt)
item.description:
Rachel Bonnetta and company are back for a brand new episode of Benched with Bonnetta! To start, Rachel is joined by Kyle Brandt to recap Week 7 in the NFL, talk about their favorite Halloween costumes, and guess what may be worn around the NFL Network this weekend (3:13). After the break, Rachel lets fans vent by opening her DMs and makes her case for why candy corn is good (15:11). Rachel wraps things up by previewing this week's Thursday night game between the Ravens and Buccaneers (21:53) and tells you the best and worst things she saw over the last week (26:43).

Note: timecodes approximate.

item.title: Monday Pt2: Packers surprise loss, Nate Burleson, Bucs Concerns, Game Balls, and a MNF Preview
item.itunes:title: Monday Pt2: Packers surprise loss, Nate Burleson, Bucs Concerns, Game Balls, and a MNF Preview
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with another loss for the Packers and Aaron Rodgers. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty debate what's the biggest issue facing Green Bay right now. Nate Burleson drops by to explain why he has more trust in the Giants than with the Jets plus what he thinks is wrong with Tom Brady and the Bucs.  The table hands out Game Balls for the best performances in Week 7 including a history making performance from Chiefs WR Mecole Hardman. We wrap up with Statement wins and a preview of MNF including how much NE QB Mac Jones will play tonight. 

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Monday Pt1: Tua Returns, Breece Hall Injury, Giants are 6-1, Dak wins, and Chiefs Roll
item.itunes:title: Monday Pt1: Tua Returns, Breece Hall Injury, Giants are 6-1, Dak wins, and Chiefs Roll
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with Tua Tagovailoa's return to the Dolphins. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty dissect how the Miami defense was actually what won the game against the Steelers.  After getting updates on injuries for Breece Hall and DK Metcalf, we examine the Giants being 6-1 and the Buccaneers shocking 3-4 record. Dak Prescott returned for the Cowboys in a win over the Lions while Christian McCaffrey joined the 49ers but it didn't make much difference against the Chiefs!

Stay tuned for Aaron Rodgers reaction to another loss and Statement wins coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Friday Pt2: Impact of CMC Trade, GMFB Jam, Nate Burleson, Spotlight Players, and Pickle Picks!
item.itunes:title: Friday Pt2: Impact of CMC Trade, GMFB Jam, Nate Burleson, Spotlight Players, and Pickle Picks!
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the impact of Christian McCaffrey being traded to the NFC West. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty think this move could be just as much about the Rams NOT getting McCaffrey. The table picks their RB/WR combo they think will top the fantasy football ranks before Nate Burleson drops by to talk CMC and the brush up between Kyler Murray and Kliff Kingsbury. We look at the players that will be in the spotlight for Week 7 then wrap up the week with Pickle Picks on the streets of NYC.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Friday Pt1: Cardinals win, CMC traded to 49ers, Dak Update, Week 7 Matchups, and Chiefs/49ers
item.itunes:title: Friday Pt1: Cardinals win, CMC traded to 49ers, Dak Update, Week 7 Matchups, and Chiefs/49ers
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Cardinals win over the Saints.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty move onto the late breaking news of Christian McCaffery being traded to the 49ers.  We look at some of the best coming matchups in NFL Week 7 before debating if the Packers are in a 'must win' situation this week against the Commanders.  We wrap up with CMC's impact on the 49ers and how much we could see him on Sunday against the Chiefs.

Stay tuned for Nate Burleson and the rest of NFL Week 7 coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: El Huddle: Breece Hall, Quarterbacks On Their Way Back and Ones With The Mal de Ojo! (featuring Hall of Famer QB and Coach Tom Flores)
item.itunes:title: El Huddle: Breece Hall, Quarterbacks On Their Way Back and Ones With The Mal de Ojo! (featuring Hall of Famer QB and Coach Tom Flores)
item.description:
Will Selva and MJ Acosta-Ruiz start off going through some of the quarterbacks; Who are they worried about? Who’s starting to settle into a groove? And who’s been cursed with the mal de ojo? Then they break down the Falcons’ momentum, Will’s prediction for Breece Hall, and who MJ suspects is eating breakfast with her dad. Then they sit down with Hall of Fame Quarterback and Coach Tom Flores to discuss Raider Nation and his suggestions for Russell Wilson and the Broncos.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Thursday Pt2: Can Dolphins keep pace? Did Seahawks heist Broncos in Russell Wilson trade?
item.itunes:title: Thursday Pt2: Can Dolphins keep pace? Did Seahawks heist Broncos in Russell Wilson trade?
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins looking at how the Miami Dolphins can get back on track and keep pace with the AFC East. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty explain what the Dolphins can do to get their mojo back. Next, Peter and Jason debate if the New York Jets youth is an advantage and if the Russell Wilson trade is turning into the biggest heist of the century. Later, everyone shares which game is a sneaky good matchup and then part two of the GMFB podcast finishes up with the hosts calling their shot on Thursday Night Football.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Thursday Pt1: Cardinals-Saints preview; Dak Prescott expectations; Danylo Boguslawski tribute; 1972 Miami Dolphins
item.itunes:title: Thursday Pt1: Cardinals-Saints preview; Dak Prescott expectations; Danylo Boguslawski tribute; 1972 Miami Dolphins
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins previewing Thursday’s matchup between the Arizona Cardinals and the New Orleans Saints. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty share what they’ll be watching for in the Cardinals-Saints matchup, with Jason focusing on the Cardinals offense led by Kyler Murray and Kyle discussing Alvin Kamara's unproductive season. Peter leads mixed bag trivia which highlights the 1972 Miami Dolphins in honor of their 50th anniversary. Kyle shares a touching tribute about Danylo Boguslawski and then part one of the GMFB podcast finishes up discussing what we should expect in Dak Prescott’s return in the Cowboys matchup against the Lions.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins previewing Thursday’s matchup between the Arizona Cardinals and the New Orleans Saints. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty share what they’ll be watching for in the Cardinals-Saints matchup, with Jason focusing on the Cardinals offense led by Kyler Murray and Kyle discussing Alvin Kamara's unproductive season. Peter leads mixed bag trivia which highlights the 1972 Miami Dolphins in honor of their 50th anniversary. Kyle shares a touching tribute about Danylo Boguslawski and then part one of the GMFB podcast finishes up discussing what we should expect in Dak Prescott’s return in the Cowboys matchup against the Lions.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Wednesday Pt2: Vikings quietly 5-1, Kenny Pickett Update, Greg Olsen, 3-3 teams, and Saints/Cardinals Preview
item.itunes:title: Wednesday Pt2: Vikings quietly 5-1, Kenny Pickett Update, Greg Olsen, 3-3 teams, and Saints/Cardinals Preview
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Vikings posting a surprisingly quiet 5-1 record.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty get an update on the status of Steelers QB Kenny Pickett before welcoming Greg Olsen to the show. The former 3x Pro Bowl TE takes us inside his son's meeting with Aaron Rodgers and how good the Jets can be.  There are 10 teams sitting at 3-3 and the table explores which one of those teams is the most interesting. We wrap up with Fmr NFL QB Ryan Leaf previewing TNF's Saints/Cardinals matchup.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Wednesday Pt1: Patriots QB situation, Gaining Respect, Recalling predictions, and Dak's Return
item.itunes:title: Wednesday Pt1: Patriots QB situation, Gaining Respect, Recalling predictions, and Dak's Return
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the surprise play of Patriots QB Bailey Zappe. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss the Patriots coming decision for a QB and which players or coaches they've gained respect for since the start of the season.  The table moves onto the 2022 predictions they made but are now getting concerned about.  This looks to be the week that Dak Prescott returns to the Cowboys, but how will it affect the race in the NFC East?  

Stay tuned for Greg Olsen and Vikings talk coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: The Season with Peter Schrager: Paul Rudd on Mahomes, Playing Fantasy Football with the Marvel Universe, and The Legend of Matsui (with Paul Rudd)
item.itunes:title: The Season with Peter Schrager: Paul Rudd on Mahomes, Playing Fantasy Football with the Marvel Universe, and The Legend of Matsui (with Paul Rudd)
item.description:
NFL Network’s Peter Schrager is joined by Paul Rudd to reflect on the Week 6 Chiefs/Bills game, the wide open NFC, and Robert Kraft’s star-studded wedding. Paul shares stories of his Avengers-only (sorta) fantasy football league, his thoughts on “Good Morning Football” and the NFL Network’s star reporters, and opens the book on various Chiefs legends and celebrity friends. Paul tells a story about the time he saw Paul McCartney play an impromptu concert at a “Saturday Night Live” rehearsal and the background behind the famous “Knocked Up“ fantasy baseball scene. Toss in some One Direction, the brilliance of Nathan Fielder, and a little Saquon Barkley appreciation, too. Enjoy!

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Tuesday Pt2: Can Buccaneers or Packers turn it around? Power Rankings; Scott Pioli
item.itunes:title: Tuesday Pt2: Can Buccaneers or Packers turn it around? Power Rankings; Scott Pioli
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O’Hara answering if the Green Bay Packers or the Tampa Bay Buccaneers have a better chance of turning their season around. Scott Pioli drops by and talks about the soaring Jets, how the Panthers can stay motivated in a lost season, and the return of DeAndre Hopkins. Later, Jamie gives her Toasts of the Town and then part two of the GMFB podcast finishes up being joined by Dan Hanzus so he can explain his latest version of his power rankings.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Tuesday Pt1: Chargers-Broncos takeaways; Panic for Packers? Blaming Tom Brady?
item.itunes:title: Tuesday Pt1: Chargers-Broncos takeaways; Panic for Packers? Blaming Tom Brady?
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O’Hara sharing their takeaways from the Chargers overtime victory over the Denver Broncos on Monday Night Football. Then Peter leads “we in or we out” where everyone answers if it’s time to be worried about the Packers and whether it’s fair to blame Tom Brady for the Buccaneers loss against Pittsburgh. Part one of the GMFB podcast finishes up discussing which northeastern NFL team has you most intrigued after week-6.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Monday Pt2: Best Week 6 Performances, Nate Burleson, MNF Preview, Are Bills/Chiefs 1-2? and Game Balls
item.itunes:title: Monday Pt2: Best Week 6 Performances, Nate Burleson, MNF Preview, Are Bills/Chiefs 1-2? and Game Balls
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the most impressive performances in Week 6.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss the teams that aren't getting headlines now but could be contenders when the season is winding down.  Nate Burleson drops by with his thoughts on the football success right now in the Big Apple plus a preview of Broncos/Chargers on MNF.  The table debates if the Bills and Chiefs are the top two teams in the NFL before handing out Game Balls for Week 6.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Monday Pt1: Eagles unbeaten, Bills beat Chiefs, Trade Rumors, Jets over Packers, and Giants down Ravens
item.itunes:title: Monday Pt1: Eagles unbeaten, Bills beat Chiefs, Trade Rumors, Jets over Packers, and Giants down Ravens
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Eagles prime time victory over the Cowboys.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss how impressive Philly looked on both sides of the ball. Josh Allen kept his poise as the Bills got past the Chiefs.  Trade rumors were the biggest thing to come out of Rams win over the Panthers.  Peter explains why Sauce Gardner and the Jets are exorcising ghosts from the past.  Meanwhile, the Giants kept pace in the NFC East with a win over the Ravens.  

Stay tuned for Nate Burleson and Game Balls coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Friday Pt2: Ravens/Giants, Nate Burleson, Week 6 matchups, Vikings WR Adam Thielen, and Pickle Picks!
item.itunes:title: Friday Pt2: Ravens/Giants, Nate Burleson, Week 6 matchups, Vikings WR Adam Thielen, and Pickle Picks!
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Giants hosting the Ravens in Week 6. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss whether the Ravens offense or the Giants defense will have an edge in the matchup.  Nate Burleson drops by to give his thoughts on Bills/Chiefs and Eagles/Cowboys.  We examine some of the best matchups for NFL Week 6 before Vikings WR Adam Thielen joins us to discuss catching his 50th career TD pass.  We wrap up the week with Week 6 Pickle Picks!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Friday Pt1: Commanders Chaos, Week 6 matchups, Cowboys/Eagles, Spotlight players, and Bills/Chiefs
item.itunes:title: Friday Pt1: Commanders Chaos, Week 6 matchups, Cowboys/Eagles, Spotlight players, and Bills/Chiefs
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Commanders win over the Bears. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champions Jason McCourty and Shaun O'Hara didn't believe the postgame sounded like it came from the winning team.  We look at some of the best matchups coming in Week 6 including Cowboys/Eagles where Demarcus Lawrence provided some billboard material for Philly.  Peter explains why Bengals WR Ja'Marr Chase is in the spotlight against the Saints.  We wrap up with excitement heading into Bills/Chiefs.

Stay tuned for Nate Burleson and Vikings WR Adam Thielen coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: El Huddle: Surprising Quarterbacks and the Importance of Tight Ends (with Hall of Famer Tony Gonzalez)
item.itunes:title: El Huddle: Surprising Quarterbacks and the Importance of Tight Ends (with Hall of Famer Tony Gonzalez)
item.description:
A little computer trouble can’t keep Will Selva and MJ Acosta-Ruiz from breaking down Davante Adams’ big push, Dak Prescott’s grip, and celebrating the upcoming games of week 6. Then, MJ reveals how a conversation with her dad revealed that her whole life has been a lie, Will takes on the Dolphins’ ping pong table for “Buy or Selva,” and they both explain why they’ve chosen a few quarterbacks for this week’s “El Perro Macho” and “The Greatness.” Then, we are joined by Hall of Fame Tight End and Thursday Night Football analyst, Tony Gonzalez, to talk about the new TNF crew and explore some of his favorite difference makers at the tight end position. Plus, Will surprises MJ with a brand new impression.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Wednesday Pt2: Ravens/Giants, Ryan Shazier, Big Deal or No Big Deal, and Shaun Alexander
item.itunes:title: Wednesday Pt2: Ravens/Giants, Ryan Shazier, Big Deal or No Big Deal, and Shaun Alexander
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Giants staring down 5-1 with the Ravens in town.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss what a win would mean for NY and Daniel Jones.  Fmr NFL LB Ryan Shazier joins us to talk Kenny Pickett and the Steelers future.  The table explores Tom Brady's comments on the quality of NFL Football and how Bears QB Justin Fields isn't feeling calm in the pocket.  Plus, Fmr MVP Shaun Alexander gives us his thoughts on the surprising Seahawks and Russell Wilson's start in Denver.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Wednesday Pt1: Cowboys/Eagles, Davante Adams charged, Surprising Players, AJ Terrell, and Bills/Chiefs.
item.itunes:title: Wednesday Pt1: Cowboys/Eagles, Davante Adams charged, Surprising Players, AJ Terrell, and Bills/Chiefs.
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with an update on Dak Prescott's thumb.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss the Cowboys visiting the Eagles on Sunday Night.  Davante Adams is charged after an postgame incident with a media member.  After looking at the most surprising players this season, Jamie explains why she doesn't like the names of coordinators being floated around for head coaching jobs.  Falcons CB AJ Terrell drops by to talk 49ers and the ATL's throwback helmets this weekend. Plus, what will be the difference maker in Bills-Chiefs? 

Stay tuned for Shaun Alexander coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: The Season with Peter Schrager: Micah’s Unicorn Season, the 49ers Resilience, and the Surprising 3-2 Jets (with Head Coach Robert Saleh)
item.itunes:title: The Season with Peter Schrager: Micah’s Unicorn Season, the 49ers Resilience, and the Surprising 3-2 Jets (with Head Coach Robert Saleh)
item.description:
NFL Network’s Peter Schrager reflects on the Arrowhead Stadium crowd’s energy for “Monday Night Football”, the opposite trajectories of the Rams and New York Giants, and why the 49ers get his shout out of the week.

Peter sits down with New York Jets head coach Robert Saleh to break down their Week 5 win over the Miami Dolphins, his relationship with Packers HC Matt LaFleur, and their furniture purchases when they were roommates in Mount Pleasant, Michigan.

Then Peter is joined by NFL Network Researcher Tony Holzman-Escareno to break down Micah Parsons and how he could impact the Cowboys’ game against the Eagles. Finally, Peter’s college buddy Aaron has the hottest take of all. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Tuesday Pt2: What's up w/ Raiders? Dan Hanzus Power Rankings; Toasts of the Town
item.itunes:title: Tuesday Pt2: What's up w/ Raiders? Dan Hanzus Power Rankings; Toasts of the Town
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty examining the 1-4 start for the Las Vegas Raiders with Jason saying the Raiders need to find a way to finish football games. Then they’re joined by Dan Hanzus for his latest iteration of his Power Rankings and he explains why he has Bills > Eagles, what he likes most about the Cowboys, and who should be considered as an early MVP. Later, Jamie shares who received her “toasts of the town” in week five, which includes a kicker and a styling quarterback. Part two of the GMFB podcast finishes up with the “taco bout it” segment where they discuss topics under-the-radar.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Tuesday Pt1: Chiefs comeback win vs. Raiders; Roughing the passer penalties; Is Panthers job desirable?
item.itunes:title: Tuesday Pt1: Chiefs comeback win vs. Raiders; Roughing the passer penalties; Is Panthers job desirable?
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty reacting to the Kansas City Chiefs 17-point comeback victory over the Las Vegas Raiders. Then Peter leads the “we in or we out” segment where the GMFB panel discusses if the Carolina Panthers is a desirable head coaching  position and if Kyler Murray’s pregame outfit was unfairly criticized. Part one of the GMFB podcast finishes up discussing the controversial roughing the passer penalty at the end of the first half in the Chiefs-Raiders game.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Monday Pt1: Ravens rebound, Eagles Undefeated, Cowboys surprise, and Jets and Giants sticking around
item.itunes:title: Monday Pt1: Ravens rebound, Eagles Undefeated, Cowboys surprise, and Jets and Giants sticking around
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Ravens getting back to basics in a win over the Bengals. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty explain how the Eagles remained undefeated while debating a Kyler Murray slide.  The Cowboys have been a big surprise and Kyle thinks Dallas should stick with Cooper Rush until he loses.  Meanwhile, the Giants and Jets have both won two straight behind strong coaching.  

Stay tuned for Nate Burleson and Game Balls coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Friday Pt1: Broncos concern, Giants/Packers in London, State of the Teams, and Week 5 Spotlight
item.itunes:title: Friday Pt1: Broncos concern, Giants/Packers in London, State of the Teams, and Week 5 Spotlight
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with a lackluster Colts win over the Broncos.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss how poorly the Broncos offense looked.  Kyle cautions that Denver's relationship with Russell Wilson could sour quickly.  We look ahead to Giants-Packers in London before exploring the best matchups of Week 5.  The NFL season is a 1/4 of the way done, so we pick random teams to evaluate.  Plus, which player will be in the spotlight in the Week 5 games?

Stay tuned for Chargers HC Brandon Staley and Nate Burleson coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Thursday Pt2: More head-scratching season-Matt Ryan or Russell Wilson; Kirk Herbstreit; Adam Rank, fantasy football
item.itunes:title: Thursday Pt2: More head-scratching season-Matt Ryan or Russell Wilson; Kirk Herbstreit; Adam Rank, fantasy football
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty looking at which quarterback, Matt Ryan or Russell Wilson, has had the more head scratching start of the season through four weeks. Then, they’re joined by Kirk Herbstreit and he talks about calling pro football vs. college football and what it’s like working with Al Michaels. Later, they’re joined by fantasy guru Adam Rank and he shares who you should start and sit this week and then part two of the podcast finishes up calling their shot on Thursday Night Football.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Wednesday Pt2: Kenny Pickett Expectations, Young core teams, Toast of the Town, and Broncos' Garrett Bolles
item.itunes:title: Wednesday Pt2: Kenny Pickett Expectations, Young core teams, Toast of the Town, and Broncos' Garrett Bolles
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with QB Kenny Pickett's chances of keeping the Steelers competitive in the AFC North.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Mike Garafolo and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss Eagles QB Jalen Hurts saying having a young core of teammates helps. Jason feels having a base of veterans is the best mix for success. Jamie offers up a toast to players and coaches that need some extra recognition after Week 4.  We wrap up with Broncos OT Garrett Bolles explaining his viral moment against the Raiders and looking ahead to Thursday night's matchup against the Colts.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Wednesday Pt1: Giants and Packers in London, Pickett starts, Game sparks, and Cowboys/Rams!
item.itunes:title: Wednesday Pt1: Giants and Packers in London, Pickett starts, Game sparks, and Cowboys/Rams!
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Giants and Packers preparing to play in London.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Mike Garafolo and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss the Giants options if Daniel Jones is unable to play due to injury.  Steelers QB Kenny Pickett gets his first start but what you can expect with him facing the Bills?  The table debates which game will have the most sparks with Kyle looking forward to Jets/Dolphins.  We wrap up with Cowboys/Rams and how long you wait to bring Dak Prescott back to the team.

Stay tuned for 'What's Your Beef?' and Broncos OT Garrett Bolles coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Tuesday Pt2: What's wrong w/ Rams? Power Rankings; Bengals S Vonn Bell
item.itunes:title: Tuesday Pt2: What's wrong w/ Rams? Power Rankings; Bengals S Vonn Bell
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Sara Walsh, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty diving into what’s gone wrong for the Los Angeles Rams through the first four weeks of this season. Next, Peter shares his rookie fab-5 list for week-4 and then they run through Dan Hanzus’ latest power rankings. Part two of the GMFB podcast finishes up being joined by Bengals safety Vonn Bell and he talks about getting back to .500, his trust in the Bengals offense, what we don’t know about Joe Burrow, and his preparation for Lamar Jackson.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Tuesday Pt1: 49ers throttle Rams; Most impressive NFC team; Save the double doink?
item.itunes:title: Tuesday Pt1: 49ers throttle Rams; Most impressive NFC team; Save the double doink?
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Sara Walsh, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty reacting to the San Francisco 49ers dominating performance over the Los Angeles Rams on Monday Night Football. Peter explains why the 49ers have a new star on defense and Kyle diagnoses the problem for the Rams. Next, everyone answers which NFC team has been the most impressive and then Peter leads “we in or we out” where Sara, Kyle and Jason must be “in or out” on statements like: “Jalen Hurts has been the best QB in the NFL” and “it’s time to move on from the term "Double Doink”.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the best storylines from Week 4.  Hosts Sara Walsh, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss what really impressed them over the weekend.  Nate Burleson drops by and tells us what he's liked from the Vikings offense and why the Broncos could be in trouble.  We look ahead to the Rams-49ers matchup on Monday Night Football, before handing out Game Balls for Week 4.  Stacey Dales wraps up Vikings/Saints and starts looking ahead to Giants/Packers in London this Sunday.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Monday Pt1: Chiefs Roll, Eagles still undefeated, Jets and Giants win, Raiders first win, and No Bucs concern
item.itunes:title: Monday Pt1: Chiefs Roll, Eagles still undefeated, Jets and Giants win, Raiders first win, and No Bucs concern
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Chiefs impressive win over the Bucs.  Hosts  Sara Walsh, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss the Eagles staying undefeated, the Bills getting past the Ravens and the Raiders getting their first win.  The Steelers make the move to Kenny Pickett, but it was Zach Wilson and the Jets that got the win.  Meanwhile, the Giants could be the most impressive team in the NFC East? 

Stay tuned for Nate Burleson and Game Balls coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Friday Pt2: Tagovailoa Reaction, Week 4 matchups, Scott Pioli, UK Q&A, GMFB Jam, and Fish and Picks!

item.title: Friday Pt1: Tagovailoa injury, League Response, Week 4 Matchups, Cris Carter, and Pro Bowl changes!
item.itunes:title: Friday Pt1: Tagovailoa injury, League Response, Week 4 Matchups, Cris Carter, and Pro Bowl changes!
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with Tua Tagovailoa's injury during the Dolphins-Bengals game. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss what the league needs to do in order to protect players and move forward. Stacey Dales gives the latest on the Saints arrival before we touch on some of the top matchups for Week 4.  Hall of Famer Cris Carter drops by with his thoughts on the Vikings and Eagles and playing overseas.  Plus, we look at upcoming changes to the Pro Bowl and future International games with NFL VP Peter O'Reilly.

Stay tuned for more Week 4 picks and Fmr NFL Exec Scott Pioli coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Thursday Pt2: Tyreek Hill or Ja'Marr Chase; Doug Pederson back in Philly; Vikings TE Steve Jordan
item.itunes:title: Thursday Pt2: Tyreek Hill or Ja'Marr Chase; Doug Pederson back in Philly; Vikings TE Steve Jordan
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty examining if Ja’Marr Chase or Tyreek Hill will have the better highlight on Thursday Night Football. Then they’re joined by former Vikings TE Steve Jordan and he talks about his career, why he’s a fan of Kirk Cousins, and what Cam Jordan was like growing up. Part two of the GMFB podcast finishes up discussing how Doug Pederson will be received back in Philadelphia, now that he's the head coach of the Jacksonville Jaguars.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Thursday Pt1: Deciding Factor in Dolphins-Bengals matchup; Was AFC West overhyped?
item.itunes:title: Thursday Pt1: Deciding Factor in Dolphins-Bengals matchup; Was AFC West overhyped?
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty looking at what a win would mean for the Cincinnati Bengals against the Miami Dolphins on Thursday Night Football. Next, they answer if the AFC West was overhyped before the season, with several teams in that division not living up to the hype. Part one of the podcast finishes up discussing what the deciding factor will be in the Bengals-Dolphins matchup.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Wednesday Pt 2: Chiefs-Bucs on Sunday Night, Bad Entrees, Dante Hall, and UK Q&A
item.itunes:title: Wednesday Pt 2: Chiefs-Bucs on Sunday Night, Bad Entrees, Dante Hall, and UK Q&A
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with a preview of Chiefs-Buccaneers on Sunday Night.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty recall last night's staff dinner and their unfortunate choice of entrees.  2x Pro Bowl Dante Hall drops by to discuss his relationship with Tyreek Hill and what the Chiefs need to do against the Bucs.  We wrap up the show with another edition of UK Q&A!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Wednesday Pt 1: Vikings-Saints in London, Dolphins-Bengals on TNF, and Sky Sports Neil Reynolds
item.itunes:title: Wednesday Pt 1: Vikings-Saints in London, Dolphins-Bengals on TNF, and Sky Sports Neil Reynolds
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with what to expect from Vikings-Saints on Sunday.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty reveal who they'd like to see more emotion from. After getting an injury update on Tua Tagovailoa, the table debates the matchups in Thursday's Dolphins-Bengals game.  Plus, Sky Sports Neil Reynolds tells us about the Jaguars fanbase overseas and when the UK could be ready for a team. 

Stay tuned for Dante Hall coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Tuesday Pt1: Cowboys hot with Cooper Rush; Giants reality check; Mike McDaniel - coach of the year?
item.itunes:title: Tuesday Pt1: Cowboys hot with Cooper Rush; Giants reality check; Mike McDaniel - coach of the year?
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty share their takeaways from the Dallas Cowboys victory over the New York Giants which moves them to 2-1. Next, the GMFB crew wonders what the future looks like for the Giants and then Peter leads “we win or we out” where Kyle, Jason and Jamie answer if they’re “in or out” on Dolphins head coach Mike McDaniel being the front runner for coach of the year.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Monday Pt2: Biggest Week 3 storylines, Rihanna Halftime, Saints in London, Match Balls, MNF Preview,
item.itunes:title: Monday Pt2: Biggest Week 3 storylines, Rihanna Halftime, Saints in London, Match Balls, MNF Preview,
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the biggest storylines from NFL Week 3.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, and Super Bowl Champions Jason McCourty and Osi Umenyiora discuss the Eagles and Ravens making waves while the Jaguars are playing surprisingly well.  The NFL announces Rihanna will perform the Super Bowl halftime show.  Stacey Dales updates us on the Saints in London before 'Match Balls' are given out.  We preview the Monday Night Football matchup between the Cowboys and Giants.  Osi explains why he believes in Daniel Jones with Brian Daboll as the head coach. Plus, Bills OC Ken Dorsey makes headlines for his outburst after their loss to the Dolphins.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the show coming from London for Vikings/Saints in Week 4.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, and Super Bowl Champions Jason McCourty and Osi Umenyiora discuss the Broncos win over the 49ers while Kyle explains why the Dolphins are the biggest story in the NFL right now.  Stacey Dales begins our coverage of Vikings-Saints and we look at the entire International slate of games. Stay tuned for Game Balls and the Monday Night Football preview coming in Part Two!

item.description:

Before heading to London for next week, we wrap up with Pickle Picks!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Friday Pt1: Browns win, Week 3 matchups, Jags WR Christian Kirk, GMFB Jam, and Kenny Pickett questions
item.itunes:title: Friday Pt1: Browns win, Week 3 matchups, Jags WR Christian Kirk, GMFB Jam, and Kenny Pickett questions
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Browns prime time victory over the Steelers.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara discuss how Jacoby Brissett and the Cleveland offense has performed.  Jaguars WR Christian Kirk stops by to discuss his first year in Jacksonville before we head to GMFB Jam, picking a WR-RB combo that will have a big weekend. With Jason McCourty joining the show after calling Thursday night's game, the table asks how the Steelers turn things around and wonder if it's time to start asking about Kenny Pickett.

Stay tuned for Commanders Head Coach Ron Rivera and Nate Burleson coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Thursday Pt2: Nick Chubb or Najee Harris; Richard Sherman; Fantasy advice from Adam Rank
item.itunes:title: Thursday Pt2: Nick Chubb or Najee Harris; Richard Sherman; Fantasy advice from Adam Rank
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O’Hara speaking with Jason McCourty live from Cleveland and everyone shares if Najee Harris or Nick Chubb will play a bigger role on Thursday Night Football. Next, they’re joined by Richard Sherman and he talks about the Steelers, Browns matchup, the experience at Prime Video, the initial struggle for Russell Wilson in Denver, and if he’d rather face against Jimmy Garoppolo or Trey Lance as a CB. Part two of the podcast finishes up being joined by fantasy instructor Adam Rank and he shares why you should start Matthew Stafford, James Robinson and DK Metcalf but sit Tua Tagovailoa.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Recapping A Wild Week 2!! (with Kyle Brandt)
item.itunes:title: Recapping A Wild Week 2!! (with Kyle Brandt)
item.description:
Rachel Bonnetta and company are back for a brand new episode of Benched with Bonnetta! To start, we talk about the WILD come-from-behind win for the Jets against the Browns (1:04). Then, Rachel is joined by Kyle Brandt to talk about which teams he's worried about after two weeks and Amon-Ra St. Brown's big Sunday (2:26). Rachel opens her DMs and gives the listeners a safe space to air out their worries (14:56). Finally, we preview Thursday night's game between the Browns and Steelers (19:53) and wrap things up with the best and worst things we saw and heard over the past week (21:58).

Note: Time codes approximate.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

Then, Rachel is joined by Kyle Brandt to talk about which teams he's worried about after two weeks and Amon-Ra St. Brown's big Sunday (2:26). Rachel opens her DMs and gives the listeners a safe space to air out their worries (14:56). Finally, we preview Thursday night's game between the Browns and Steelers (19:53) and wrap things up with the best and worst things we saw and heard over the past week (21:58).

Note: Time codes approximate.

item.title: Tuesday Pt2: Most impressive NFL teams; Giants S Julian Love; Lions CB Jeff Okudah; Power Rankings

item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty focusing on which team has showed them the most through two weeks of the NFL season. Next, they’re joined by Giants S Julian Love and he talks about the buzz in NYC after their 2-0 start, what it’s like to play for coach Daboll, what it means to be a captain on the Giants and the upcoming matchup against the Cowboys. Later they’re joined by Lions CB Jeff Okudah and he talks about playing for his enthusiastic coach Dan Campbell, the upcoming challenge of facing Justin Jefferson, and his teammate Dan Skipper. Part two of the podcast finishes up being joined by Dan Hanzus to deliver his latest version of his power rankings.

item.title: Monday Pt2: Jimmy G takes the reins, Week 2 surprises, Game Balls, Head Scratchers, and a MNF Preview!
item.itunes:title: Monday Pt2: Jimmy G takes the reins, Week 2 surprises, Game Balls, Head Scratchers, and a MNF Preview!
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with Jimmy G taking over for the 49ers after a season ending injury for Trey Lance.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss how the 49ers handle the next offseason without repeating this QB process.  Peter explains how the Dolphins are his early surprise with Mike McDaniel getting some big wins early.  We give out four Game Balls before looking at the head scratching moments from Week 2.  We wrap up with a preview of the Monday Night Football Doubleheader with Titans/Bills and Vikings/Eagles.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Monday Pt1: Packers over Bears, Giants 2-0, Tagovailoa Respect, Bengals 0-2, Cowboys and Cardinals Surprises
item.itunes:title: Monday Pt1: Packers over Bears, Giants 2-0, Tagovailoa Respect, Bengals 0-2, Cowboys and Cardinals Surprises
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Packers win over the Bears. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty marvel at the Giants being able to find a way to win again and start the season 2-0. The Dolphins are getting respect after a comeback win over the Ravens.  We debate if the Cowboys win was more surprising than the Bengals 0-2 start.  Plus, Kyler Murray was electric, but can this formula win all season long?  Stay tuned for Jimmy G and Monday Night Football Previews coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Friday Pt2: Justin Herbert Injury, Von Miller, Week 2 Matchups, Nate Burleson, and Pickle Picks!
item.itunes:title: Friday Pt2: Justin Herbert Injury, Von Miller, Week 2 Matchups, Nate Burleson, and Pickle Picks!
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with Chargers QB Justin Herbert's injury in a loss to the Chiefs. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss how the Chargers should have won and maybe protected their QB. Bills LB Von Miller drops by to discuss his win against the Rams and his first game in Buffalo.  We dive into more Week 2 matchups including the Packers, Cardinals and 49ers all trying to avoid 0-2 starts. Nate Burleson checks in to calm everyone down regarding Herbert's injury.  Wrapping the week up, the crew heads to the streets of NYC to give their Pickle Picks for Week 2.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Friday Pt1: Chiefs over Chargers, Week 2 matchups, Spotlight Sunday, and KC Confidence
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Chiefs comeback win over the Chargers. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss Justin Herbert's injury and the unlikely hero for Kansas City.  The table starts looking at the top matchups for NFL Week 2 before highlighting the specific players they'll be watching.  We wrap up with growing confidence in Kansas City despite some big offseason changes. Kyle explains his hesitations with buying into the Chiefs too early.  Stay tuned for Bills LB Von Miller and Nate Burleson coming in Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Thursday Pt2: Mahomes vs. Herbert; Ryan Leaf on Josh Allen, Tom Brady & Cowboys; Andrew Whitworth
item.itunes:title: Thursday Pt2: Mahomes vs. Herbert; Ryan Leaf on Josh Allen, Tom Brady & Cowboys; Andrew Whitworth
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty focusing on which quarterback, Patrick Mahomes or Justin Herbert, will give the best highlight on Thursday Night Football. Next, they’re joined by former #2 overall pick Ryan Leaf and he talks about Josh Allen’s maturation, the state of the Cowboys, why he believes the Vikings will win the NFC North, and Tom Brady’s longevity. Part two of the podcast finishes up with Andrew Whitworth and he talks about prepping for Thursday Night Football on Prime Video, why it was tough not being a part of the guys before the Rams played in week-1, and how Sean McVay responds after a loss.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Thursday Pt1: Deciding factor in Chiefs, Chargers showdown; Fabulous 5 rookies; Brian Baumgartner
item.itunes:title: Thursday Pt1: Deciding factor in Chiefs, Chargers showdown; Fabulous 5 rookies; Brian Baumgartner
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty sharing what will be the deciding factor in determining the winner between the Chiefs and Chargers on Thursday Night Football. Next, Peter delivers his ‘fabulous 5 rookies’ in week-1 and then they’re joined by Kevin from The Office, Brian Baumgartner, and he talks about why he’s not worried about the Packers, one team that should be concerned after their week-1 loss, and the Broncos decision to kick a 64-yard field goal with the game on the line. Part one of the podcast finishes up with everyone sharing which winless team or player in week-1 gave them hope for week-2.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Wednesday Pt2: Week 2 must wins? AJ Brown, Run the Category, and Broncos Blunder
item.itunes:title: Wednesday Pt2: Week 2 must wins? AJ Brown, Run the Category, and Broncos Blunder
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with teams that really need a win in Week 2.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss the teams that cannot afford an 0-2 start.  WR AJ Brown drops by to examine his debut week with the Eagles and preview their MNF matchup against the Vikings.  After being featured on Jeopardy last night, the GMFB crew plays a round of 'Run the Category'.  We wrap up with Broncos Head Coach Nathaniel Hackett admitting he should have made a different 4th down call against the Seahawks.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

Part two of the podcast finishes up with everyone sharing their favorite images from week-1.

item.title: Tuesday Pt1: Seahawks, Broncos controversial finish; Cowboys QB options; Giants stun Titans
item.itunes:title: Tuesday Pt1: Seahawks, Broncos controversial finish; Cowboys QB options; Giants stun Titans
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast focuses on the finish to the Seattle Seahawks, Denver Broncos game on Monday Night Football.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty react to the Broncos attempting a 64-yard field goal instead of allowing Russell Wilson to move the chains. Next, Peter leads the “we in or we out” segment and asks the panel if the Cowboys should be in or out on signing Cam Newton. Later, everyone answers what made them feel blue about week-1 and then they finish part one of the podcast reacting to the Giants dramatic comeback against the Titans.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Monday Pt2: Best Wins of the Week, Nate Burleson, Russell Wilson returns to Seattle on MNF, Game Balls, and Cowboys QB options
item.itunes:title: Monday Pt2: Best Wins of the Week, Nate Burleson, Russell Wilson returns to Seattle on MNF, Game Balls, and Cowboys QB options
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the best wins from Week One. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty preview Russell Wilson's return to Seattle on MNF with Nate Burleson.  Nate also doesn't think we've seen the best from Trey Lance and the 49ers.  We give out Week One Game Balls before looking at the Cowboys QB options.  Kyle would like to see Ezekiel Elliott carry Dallas in Dak's absence.  

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Monday Pt1: NFL Week 1, Dak Prescott and TJ Watt injuries, Packers loss, Browns win, and Giants hope
item.itunes:title: Monday Pt1: NFL Week 1, Dak Prescott and TJ Watt injuries, Packers loss, Browns win, and Giants hope
item.description:
Part One of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with Week 1 of the NFL and bad news for the Cowboys and Steelers. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss Dak Prescott and TJ Watt both facing significant injuries.  Jason has a lot of concern about the Packers defense, while Peter explains how the Browns are going to be a good team this season.  Jamie lays out the Bengals issues, but thinks there's some hope in the loss.  Speaking of hope, Kyle has some for the Giants and Brian Daboll. Stay tuned for Part Two!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:

Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty preview some of the best Week 1 matchtups before Peter tackles his Top 5 Burning Questions for this season.  The table offers WR-RB combos they expect to have the best Fantasy performances.  Kyle explains why the Bills performance should be scary for the rest of the league.  We wrap up with updates on WR Michael Thomas and the contract talks for QB Lamar Jackson. Stay tuned for Part Two!

item.description:

Next, hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty are joined by Packers safety Adrian Amos and he talks about competing against Aaron Rodgers in practice, the new look wide receiver core taking on a larger role, being overlooked nationally, and facing Justin Jefferson on Sunday. Later, they’re joined by fantasy sensei Adam Rank and he shares which WR this weekend will rule their craft, the RB with the most favorable matchup, and which QB will hit all their targets. Part two of the podcast finishes up with survival week picks.

Part one of the podcast finishes up with Peter and Jason’s Super Bowl picks.

item.title: Monday Pt2: Teams needing attention, Chargers or Bengals, Cardinals-Chiefs matchup, and Fantasy Football picks
item.itunes:title: Monday Pt2: Teams needing attention, Chargers or Bengals, Cardinals-Chiefs matchup, and Fantasy Football picks
item.description:
Part Two of the Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the teams that haven't gotten the offseason attention they deserve.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty debate the Chargers being a safer pick than the Bengals.  Looking ahead to the season, we preview what to expect when the Cardinals host the Chiefs in Week 1.  Prediction Week continues with the Defensive Rookie of the Year nominees.  We wrap up with Fantasy Football projections for 49ers-Bears.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: NFC Surprise teams, Wild Fantasy Football, Lamar Jackson waiting, and Mike Tirico
item.itunes:title: NFC Surprise teams, Wild Fantasy Football, Lamar Jackson waiting, and Mike Tirico
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with surprise teams coming out of the NFC. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara debate the Bears and Giants as contenders.  Jamie offers a wild Fantasy Football take that Patrick Mahomes will not be a top five scoring QB.  We discuss the impact that Russell Wilson's new deal with Denver will have on Baltimore's negotiations with QB Lamar Jackson.  Mike Tirico drops by to talk about exciting games on Sunday Night Football and the future of Notre Dame Football.  Plus, we explore which 2021 playoff team has the most improved roster.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Surprise NFL teams; Can Vikings contend in NFC? Week-1 hype train; Russell Wilson signs massive extension
item.itunes:title: Surprise NFL teams; Can Vikings contend in NFC? Week-1 hype train; Russell Wilson signs massive extension
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins looking at how serious you should take the Minnesota Vikings in the NFC. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O’Hara share their take on what could make the Vikings NFC contenders this season and then they share which surprise NFL team could be this year’s Bengals. Later, the GMFB panel discusses what they’re most excited for in week one and they’re joined by fantasy analyst Adam Rank and he shares which player is too low on draft boards and who could be a surprise star. The show finishes up with quick reaction to Russell Wilson signing an extension with Denver.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: NFL Rosters Set, Rodgers disrespected, 49ers doubt, Notable Cuts, and a McCourty surprise!
item.itunes:title: NFL Rosters Set, Rodgers disrespected, 49ers doubt, Notable Cuts, and a McCourty surprise!
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with rosters being cut down to 52 players. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara compare the rosters of the Eagles and Cowboys after Philly trades for Chauncey Gardner-Johnson.   Aaron Rodgers is being disrespected in Fantasy Football leagues, but Kyle doubts it bothers the Packers QB.  The table thinks the 49ers keeping Jimmy G could be a lack of trust in Trey Lance.  Shaun explains why surviving cut day doesn't definitely mean you've made the team.  We wrap up with the QB situations to watch throughout this upcoming season and Jason McCourty making a surprise appearance from the hospital.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Jimmy G's deal with 49ers; Patriots & Dolphins question marks; Breakout stars; Ian Eagle; Anthony Anderson
item.itunes:title: Jimmy G's deal with 49ers; Patriots & Dolphins question marks; Breakout stars; Ian Eagle; Anthony Anderson
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins reacting to Jimmy Garoppolo and the San Francisco 49ers agreeing to a new contract which will make him the highest paid backup quarterback in the NFL. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty credit Jimmy G and then explain how this could hurt the development of Trey Lance. Next, the GMFB panel answers if the Miami Dolphins or New England Patriots have more question marks and then Peter shares why Marcus Epps and Rondale Moore could be breakout stars in 2022. Later, they’re joined by announcer Ian Eagle and he shares a story about being shamed by Tom Brady and then he touches on major NFL storylines. The show finishes up being joined by actor Anthony Anderson and he shares a funny story about Kerry Kittles and he talks about high hopes for the Raiders.

item.title: Brady has a lot going on, NFL Top 100, Steelers QB questions, Bills release Araiza, and Week 1 excitement
item.itunes:title: Brady has a lot going on, NFL Top 100, Steelers QB questions, Bills release Araiza, and Week 1 excitement
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with Tom Brady giving a different kind of press conference that we're used to getting from him.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Mike Garafolo, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty move onto the NFL Top 100 where the outrage is Josh Allen being #13.  The Steelers aren't telling us who their starting QB will be and the table is split between Pickett and Trubisky getting the nod.  We discuss the Bills releasing punter Matt Araiza before looking ahead to Week 1 and the QB season debut to watch. 

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the next steps for the Bengals. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss the hurdles and possible letdown that Cincinnati will face this season.   The table debates Josh Allen or Patrick Mahomes being higher on the NFL Top 100 before looking at the Packers offense leading into tonight's game vs the Chiefs.  Peter explains why the Saints could be relevant team with all the playmakers they have on their roster.  Throwdown Thursday puts Stefon Diggs vs Tyreek Hill.  Super Bowl Champ Mitchell Schwartz drops by to discuss his retirement and the big stories starting off this season.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Can Saquon Barkley get healthy? New look Bills; Underestimated players; Newly retired Shaquem Griffin
item.itunes:title: Can Saquon Barkley get healthy? New look Bills; Underestimated players; Newly retired Shaquem Griffin
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins analyzing if Saquon Barkley can get back to an elite level running back and lead the New York Giants to a playoff spot. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager react to Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty's top-5 comeback stories in sports. Next, they take a look at the new look Buffalo Bills and they bring up a potential concern that could arise in Buffalo and then the GMFB panel gets into “whiteboard Wednesday” where they answer questions about the most underestimated teams and players, which player they would chose to get lunch with, and psychotic behaviors. The show finishes up with newly retired linebacker Shaquem Griffin and he talks about his NFL journey, how he surprised people at his combine, and playing with his twin brother in Seattle.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

Later, Kyle makes up funny fantasy team names and then the show finishes up with Peter listing his top-5 rookie risers.

item.title: Deshaun Watson Settlement, Top RB in NFL Top 100, Protecting Justin Fields, Peter's Watch List, and NFL Preseason
item.itunes:title: Deshaun Watson Settlement, Top RB in NFL Top 100, Protecting Justin Fields, Peter's Watch List, and NFL Preseason
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with Deshaun Watson's settlement with the NFL. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss the league trying to move forward from the situation but also getting conflicting statements from the Browns.  We move onto the NFL Top 100 and wonder if Jonathan Taylor or Derrick Henry will be the top RB on the list.  The Bears got a preseason win last night, but Kyle has real concerns over the protection of QB Justin Fields. Peter gives his list of players he'll be watching for big performances from before we look at the full slate of NFL preseason games this weekend.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Future for Jalen Hurts; Derwin James gets paid; Rodgers calls out WR's; Healing wounds
item.itunes:title: Future for Jalen Hurts; Derwin James gets paid; Rodgers calls out WR's; Healing wounds
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins analyzing if Jalen Hurts can be the long term solution in Philadelphia. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty share concerns they have about Jalen Hurts. Next, they react to the Los Angeles Chargers making Derwin James the highest paid safety in NFL history and then they conduct their WR fantasy draft. Later, they’re joined by friend of the program Scott Pioli and he delivers his thoughts on players getting cut, Aaron Rodgers publicly calling out young WR’s, and the value of joint practices. The show finishes up with Peter playing the role as Dr. Schrager and he heals the wounds of Vikings, Jets and Bears fans.
