item.title: Best offense in NFL? QB with highest expectations? Bills HC Sean McDermott; Broncos S Justin Simmons
item.itunes:title: Best offense in NFL? QB with highest expectations? Bills HC Sean McDermott; Broncos S Justin Simmons
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins examining if the Cincinnati Bengals have the best offense in the league. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty look around the league and compare the Bengals offense to other elite offenses like the Buffalo Bills, Kansas City Chiefs and Los Angeles Chargers. Next, the GMFB panel analyzes if Josh Allen has the highest of expectations this season and then they’re joined by Bills head coach Sean McDermott and he talks about the it factor of Josh Allen, the addition of Von Miller and the 82-yard-punt. Later, they’re joined by Broncos S Justin Simmons and he talks about being inside the top-100 of NFL players, facing against Russell Wilson in practice, and the competitive AFC West. The show finishes up being joined by newly retired NFL player Beau Allen and he talks about what he’ll miss the most, the Super Bowl victory in his hometown, and going from Philadelphia to New England.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with Jets QB Zach Wilson's injury. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty debate if Jimmy Garoppolo could be an option in NY.  Jason defends Packers QB Jordan Love and isn't taking too much out of a preseason performance.  Kenny Pickett looked impressive and hopes for the Steelers offense could have been overlooked.  The table debates the partial release of the NFL Top 100 and the placement of players from 51-100.  We get the best performances from Week 1 of the NFL preseason before Kyle explains why any thought of a QB competition in Carolina is already over.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Ravens and Giants preseason victories. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Mike Garofolo, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty were impressed with Titans QB Malik Willis.  Cam Heyward stops by to talk Steelers defense and Mitch Trubisky.  The table previews tonight's 49ers-Packers preseason matchup before Nate Burleson joins in with his thoughts on Lions HC Dan Campbell and Matthew Stafford's elbow.  GMFB wraps the week with players we'll be watching in the full slate of preseason games this weekend.

item.title: Patriots offense in shambles? Preseason watch list; Washington WR Jahan Dotson; Blind Take Test
item.itunes:title: Patriots offense in shambles? Preseason watch list; Washington WR Jahan Dotson; Blind Take Test
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins looking at how concerned the New England Patriots should be after early reports indicate the offense hasn’t looked sharp in training camp. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty react to the reports coming out of Patriots training camp. Then they’re joined by Washington Commanders WR Jahan Dotson and he shares how it’s been adapting to the pro game and he also explains why he’s a big fan of Carson Wentz. Later, the GMFB crew plays a hilarious game of “blind take test” where Kyle has to defend why the Lions will be this years Bengals and Jason has to defend why a plane seat mate is the best way to make a new friend. The podcast finishes up with Peter’s preseason watch list

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Goodell on Watson appeal, Becton Injury, Jamaal Williams on Hard Knocks, Ravens' Mark Andrews, and Bucs/Dolphins joint practice
item.itunes:title: Goodell on Watson appeal, Becton Injury, Jamaal Williams on Hard Knocks, Ravens' Mark Andrews, and Bucs/Dolphins joint practice
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with Jets Head Coach Robert Saleh's comforting reaction to Mekhi Becton's injury.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty hear Roger Goodell discuss the league's appeal of Deshaun Watson's suspension.  Lions RB Jamaal Williams drops by after his emotional appearance on the debut of Hard Knocks.  Ravens TE Mark Andrews returns to GMFB with insight on Lamar Jackson's contract and how his team rebounds from an injury plagued 2021.  We get a Falcons training camp update before previewing the Buccaneers/Dolphins joint practices happening this week.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: How Cowboys can change; More focused Mahomes? Training camp brawls; Packers WR Allen Lazard
item.itunes:title: How Cowboys can change; More focused Mahomes? Training camp brawls; Packers WR Allen Lazard
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins reacting to Jerry Jones’ comments from Dallas Cowboys training camp. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty explain how this year can be different than the previous disappointing years for the Cowboys. Next, Peter leads the “we in or we out” segment and they discuss if a brawl can be good for a training camp locker room. Later, the GMFB panel reacts to Patrick Mahomes’ training camp thoughts on the competitive AFC West and they wonder if we’re going to see a more focused Mahomes this season. The show finishes up being joined by Packers WR Allen Lazard and he talks about his journey to the NFL, his role with the Packers with Davante Adams on another team, and what it’s like to work with Aaron Rodgers.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: NFL Preseason schedule, Giants QB plan, Bengals or Chiefs, Panthers QB Competition, and Saints hope
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Patriots hosting the Giants on Thursday.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss the possibility of Daniel Jones getting a new deal in NY.  The table debates who is more likely to get back to the AFC Championship game, the Chiefs or Bengals?  We get training camp updates from Saints camp and Panthers camp, where it's beginning to become clear who will be starting for Carolina.  Also, Steve Mariucci tells us why he isn't worried about the Chiefs without Tyreek Hill this season.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Hall of Fame Game, Aaron Rodgers Offseason, Raiders Expectations, and Jets camp
item.itunes:title: Hall of Fame Game, Aaron Rodgers Offseason, Raiders Expectations, and Jets camp
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with The Hall of Fame Game in Canton, Ohio. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss an impressive debut for Travon Walker even in defeat.  AJ Brown gives his thoughts on leaving Tennessee while Aaron Rodgers expands his mind and contemplates his future in the NFL.  Jason explains why Rodgers tenure in Green Bay will be as long as the QB wants it to be.  The table debates how important a playoff run will be for the Raiders, but Peter doesn't want to hear talk about the schedule. We wrap the week with a stop at Jets camp and early thoughts on Zach Wilson.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: NFL appeals Deshaun Watson suspension; Big leap for Tua? Massive expectations for Bills; Newly retired LB K.J. Wright
item.itunes:title: NFL appeals Deshaun Watson suspension; Big leap for Tua? Massive expectations for Bills; Newly retired LB K.J. Wright
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with insiders Tom Pelissero and Judy Battista sharing the latest news surrounding Deshaun Watson and the NFL appeal.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty share their reaction to the NFL appealing Deshaun Watson’s six game suspension. Next, the GMFB crew discusses on “we in or we out” if Tua Tagovailoa will make a giant leap this year, and then they’re joined by newly retired linebacker K.J. Wright and he shares why he’s still on cloud nine, what led him to walk away from the game, and how Russell Willson will fit with Denver. The podcast finishes up with a live look in at Bills camp and then the hosts wonder if it’s a forgone conclusion that the Bills will be in the AFC Championship.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Vin Scully Tribute, Brady Super Bowl Chance, Dolphins lose pick, Russell Wilson outlook, and 49ers hopes
item.itunes:title: Vin Scully Tribute, Brady Super Bowl Chance, Dolphins lose pick, Russell Wilson outlook, and 49ers hopes
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with a tribute to broadcaster Vin Scully and his impact on the sports community in Los Angeles.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty discuss Tom Brady's chances at winning another Super Bowl this season.  The Dolphins face disciplinary measures for tampering with Brady and Sean Payton.  The table explores the best backups in the league before looking at the success that Russell Wilson could have Year 1 in Denver.  We also ask what the 49ers need to happen for a return to the NFC Championship game.  

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Reaction to Deshaun Watson discipline; Summer blockbusters; Texans QB Davis Mills; Live from Buccaneers camp
item.itunes:title: Reaction to Deshaun Watson discipline; Summer blockbusters; Texans QB Davis Mills; Live from Buccaneers camp
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins unpacking statements delivered following the disciplinary action against Deshaun Watson. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Mike Garofolo, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty explain which parts of the Deshaun Watson situation isn’t sitting well with them. Next, the GMFB panel welcomes a new segment called: “Summer Blockbusters” and then they’re joined by Houston Texans quarterback Davis Mills and he talks about the responsibility of being a starter, his preparation for year two and the veteran teammate he leans on. Later, they’re joined by Scott Pioli and he talks about the Steelers cap situation, Mike Tomlin, and the contract discussions between Lamar Jackson and the Baltimore Ravens. The podcast finishes up with a live report from Buccaneers camp.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Deshaun Watson ruling, Will NFL appeal? Giants camp update, Browns and teammate Reaction
item.itunes:title: Deshaun Watson ruling, Will NFL appeal? Giants camp update, Browns and teammate Reaction
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with a disciplinary ruling that Deshaun Watson will serve a 6 game suspension following accusations of sexual misconduct.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Mike Garofolo, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty are joined by reporters Ian Rapoport, Judy Battista and Tom Pelissero to dissect what the ruling means and the next steps from the NFL.  We visit Rhett Lewis and Brian Baldinger at Giants camp and discuss how Brian Daboll is handing his first camp as a head coach in New York.  Back to the top news, Jamie and Kyle express their frustration with how the Watson ruling seems to continue an ongoing issue the league has dealing with these circumstances.  Jason reveals how he would deal with being a Browns player through the situation. 

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Kyler Murray contract changed, DK Metcalf paid, Training Camp questions/answers, and Lamar Jackson contract standstill
item.itunes:title: Kyler Murray contract changed, DK Metcalf paid, Training Camp questions/answers, and Lamar Jackson contract standstill
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Cardinals removing a study clause from Kyler Murray's new contract. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Mike Garofolo, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty give their thoughts on Murray's press conference to address the issue.  We ask Training Camp questions before exploring Lamar Jackson still waiting for a new deal.  Jason explains why he understands Dak Prescott wanting to look back at the disastrous way last season ended.  Plus, the table looks at what players they're expecting to see make a big leap this season.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Baker or Darnold in Carolina? NFL breakout duo; Devin McCourty
item.itunes:title: Baker or Darnold in Carolina? NFL breakout duo; Devin McCourty
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast dives into the quarterback competition between Baker Mayfield and Sam Darnold in Carolina. Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty explain who’s most likely to get the starting quarterback job and why the future is at stake for Baker and Darnold. Next, they’re joined by Jason’s twin brother, Devin McCourty and he talks about how to get under Jason’s skin and which of them would pay the bill. Later, the GMFB crew shares which duo in the NFL is due for a breakout season - find out which defensive duos Jason and Peter picked to breakout, and then they dive into a new segment where the crew needs to defend a take using 10 random words.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with Jerry Jones remarks as the Cowboys open training camp.  Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty explain the pressure and expectations that Mike McCarthy faces as the head coach in Dallas. Sara Walsh gives us the latest on Julio Jones joining Tom Brady and the Buccaneers.  Aaron Rodgers had an epic camp debut but how will the Packers offense fare this season?  Ian Rapoport and Mike Garofolo report from Eagles camp with expectations starting to pile onto Jalen Hurts.  Plus, the table debates how Trey Lance will lead the 49ers.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:

Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty explain why the clause in Murray’s contract is crazy and then they play “we in or we out” where they discuss if the Dallas Cowboys should be the favorites in the NFC East. Later, the GMFB panel responds to Tyreek Hill’s comments about Tua Tagovailoa, where he called Tua the “most accurate quarterback in the NFL”. The show finishes up being joined by Indianapolis Colts DE Yannick Ngakoue and he talks about preparing for his first season with Indy, his mentorship by Howie Long, and his relationship with Colts fans.

item.title: New hosts on GMFB, Super Bowl dark horses, Carr Top 5? and AFC contenders question marks
item.itunes:title: New hosts on GMFB, Super Bowl dark horses, Carr Top 5? and AFC contenders question marks
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast opens with introducing two new hosts joining the show! Hosts Jamie Erdahl, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Jason McCourty dive into training camps getting underway and the new faces teams will be seeing.  Getting to know our new hosts, Jason explains why the Ravens are his dark horse Super Bowl contender and Jamie reveals being a Randy Moss fan while growing up.  The table debates if Derek Carr is a Top 5 QB in the NFL, before asking which player they want to hear more from in the 2022 season.  We wrap up with question marks surrounding the best teams in the AFC and who are the real contenders.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Best spot for Jimmy G; Raiders overhyped or under-hyped? Baker's role in Carolina; Steelers CB Levi Wallace
item.itunes:title: Best spot for Jimmy G; Raiders overhyped or under-hyped? Baker's role in Carolina; Steelers CB Levi Wallace
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with a look around the league for the ideal spot for Jimmy Garoppolo. Hosts Will Selva, James Palmer, Mike Garafolo, and Super Bowl champion Shaun O’Hara explain why the Miami Dolphins, Houston Texans and the Cleveland Browns would be a good landing spot for Jimmy G and then the guys discuss if the Las Vegas Raiders are overhyped or under-hyped. Later, the GMFB crew answers how Baker Mayfield can be the starter in Carolina, who Justin Fields’ favorite target will be, and what Saints head coach Dennis Allen should be focusing on. The show finishes up being joined by Steelers CB Levi Wallace and he talks about filling the role of Joe Haden, why the Steelers could have the best defense in 2022, and how he expects his return to Buffalo to go.

item.title: Jets playoff hopes; Packers Super Bowl odds; AFC West checklist; Madden ratings; Mitchell Schwartz
item.itunes:title: Jets playoff hopes; Packers Super Bowl odds; AFC West checklist; Madden ratings; Mitchell Schwartz
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins exploring how the New York Jets could become playoff contenders this season.  Hosts Will Selva, James Palmer, Mike Garafolo, and Super Bowl champion Shaun O’Hara share their ideas on how the Jets can take the next step with Zach Wilson as quarterback. Next, the GMFB crew discusses if the Green Bay Packers have a Super Bowl level supporting cast surrounding Aaron Rodgers and then they dive into the AFC West checklist, where the hosts list three items for success for each team in the division. Later, in honor of Madden ratings, the hosts share what their friends or family would give them a 15 rating in. The show finishes up being joined by newly retired Mitchell Schwartz and he talks about the biggest highlight of his career, his initial reaction to the Tyreek Hill trade, and the biggest threat to the Chiefs in the AFC West.

item.title: The Bucs reach the Super Bowl if _______, Lamar Jackson critics; AFC North checklist; Comedian Paul Virzi; Saints S Chauncey Gardner-Johnson
item.itunes:title: The Bucs reach the Super Bowl if _______, Lamar Jackson critics; AFC North checklist; Comedian Paul Virzi; Saints S Chauncey Gardner-Johnson
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins exploring how the Tampa Bay Buccaneers can win their second Super Bowl with Tom Brady. Hosts Rachel Bonnetta, Tom Pelissero, Darius Butler and Adam Rank provide reasons why the Buccaneers could hoist another Super Bowl trophy and then the GMFB crew discusses if there’s any truth to the Lamar Jackson criticism. Next, they’re joined by comedian Paul Virzi and he delivers funny bits on the New York Jets and Giants and then they play a game called “acceptable or unacceptable.” Later, Adam Rank gives insights on how the Cincinnati Bengals can get back to the Super Bowl, Darius Butler gives advice to the Pittsburgh Steelers on their quarterback situation, Tom Pelissero suggests that the Cleveland Browns should be prepared to adjust their plan based on the outcome of Deshaun Watson, and Rachel Bonnetta pleads for the Baltimore Ravens to remain healthy. The show finishes up being joined by Saints safety Chauncey Gardner-Johnson and he explains why they have the best defense in the league and then he shares why he gets under opponents skin.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: QB's under most pressure; Davante Adams or Tyreek Hill; NFC West checklist; Blind Take Test
item.itunes:title: QB's under most pressure; Davante Adams or Tyreek Hill; NFC West checklist; Blind Take Test
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins examining which quarterbacks are the most under pressure in 2022. Hosts Rachel Bonnetta, Tom Pelissero, Darius Butler and Adam Rank explain why they think Matt Ryan, Ryan Tannehill, Tua Tagovailoa and Zach Wilson are under the most pressure and then they discuss if Davante Adams or Tyreek Hill will have the better fantasy season. Later, Adam Rank provides a 3-step plan for the Arizona Cardinals to take a leap in the NFC West, Tom Pelissero shares how the Los Angeles Rams can prevent a Super Bowl hangover, Darius Butler gives his insights on how the San Francisco 49ers can fix their problems and Rachel Bonnetta makes three suggestions to the Seattle Seahawks, which includes winning in week-1. Next, Darius Butler has to defend Mitch Trubisky being a dark horse MVP candidate and Adam Rank has to defend Nickelback being one of the most underrated bands of all time during the “Blind Take Test” game. The show finishes up being joined by Philadelphia Eagles linebacker Shaun Bradley and he talks about doing anything to get a ring, his excitement for Jalen Hurts, and his funny moment with his head coach Nick Sirianni.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Panthers QB Competition, NFC East Checklist, Pivotal Player in NFC West, and Chiefs Justin Reid
item.description:

item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins looking at how Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts will adjust in year three. Hosts Rachel Bonnetta, Tom Pelissero, Darius Butler and Adam Rank explain why they have confidence in Hurts and then they share which team is the biggest threat to the Kansas City Chiefs in the AFC West. Later, the GMFB crew defines success for each team in the NFC South and then in honor of Heinz field, the panel shares things they aren’t used to yet like the Raiders being in Las Vegas. The show finishes up being joined by former NFL GM Scott Pioli and he weighs in on the Carolina Panthers trading for Baker Mayfield, the Las Vegas Raiders making history hiring Sandra Douglass Morgan, and how Jalen Hurts can take strides in year three.

item.title: Mayfield to Panthers, 2nd year expectations, Cowboys elite? NFC North Checklist, and The Superstar Club
item.itunes:title: Mayfield to Panthers, 2nd year expectations, Cowboys elite? NFC North Checklist, and The Superstar Club
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast returns with Baker Mayfield being traded to the Panthers. Hosts Rachel Bonnetta, Tom Pelissero, Adam Rank, and Fmr NFL DB Darius Butler debate how much of an upgrade the move is for Carolina.  Tom explains his high expectations of Trevor Lawrence in his 2nd season, while Rachel will be watching Zach Wilson.  We look at the Cowboys and how close they are to being an elite team.  The table puts together a checklist of needs for the NFC North before taking a closer look at The Superstar Club list from Dan Hanzus. Adam wraps up with his 'State of the Franchise' for the Kansas City Chiefs.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

The show finishes up being joined by Dallas Cowboys DT Osa Odighizuwa and he talks about his activity on Twitter and then makes a pitch to the fans on why the Cowboys will be good this year.

item.content:encoded:

Next, Kyle runs through his top-5 fullbacks of all time and then Peter leads “mixed bag trivia” where he asks questions about the Green Bay Packers all-time leading receiver and the defensive player with the most Super Bowl rings. Later, the GMFB crew is joined by Minnesota Vikings linebacker Janarius Robinson and he talks about his return after missing last season, and then he shares what it’s like having Kevin O’Connell as the head coach. The show finishes up being joined by Dallas Cowboys DT Osa Odighizuwa and he talks about his activity on Twitter and then makes a pitch to the fans on why the Cowboys will be good this year.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Confidence in Dolphins; Bills or Chiefs; AJ McCarron; Who's scary but exciting?
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins discussing how the Miami Dolphins can take the next step and become a Super Bowl contender. Hosts Sara Walsh, Peter Schrager, Kyle Brandt and Super Bowl champion Jason McCourty examine if Tua Tagovailoa is good enough to take the Dolphins to the next level. Next, they describe the New York Jets upcoming season in five words and then they each share a team that’s scary but exciting! Later, the GMFB panel has to decide if they’re more confident in the Kansas City Chiefs or Buffalo Bills. The show finishes up being joined by NFL free agent QB AJ McCarron and he makes his pitch to GM’s about joining a team and he talks about getting back on the field after his injury.

item.description:

item.description:
The 'Best of' Edition of The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with reaction to some of the 2022 NFL Draft Picks. Hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara discuss which team drew their attention.  We move onto schedule Gauntlets and why the Panthers have never had a Madden cover athlete.  Jane Slater and Michael Robinson join in with their Rookie Excitement Scale around Kenneth Walker III and Aidan Hutchinson. The table debates which team improved the most after the Draft and whether or not Kyle jinxed the Bills with a Super Bowl prediction. We wrap up with Joe Burrow learning from Kurt Warner after his Super Bowl loss.

item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with Lamar Jackson and Kyler Murray showing up for team minicamps. item.itunes:title: Hunter Renfrow Deal, Davante Adams speaks, Who gets first Super Bowl win, NFC East questions, and Belmont Stakes
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Raiders giving Hunter Renfrow a 2yr/$32 million extension.  Hosts Kyle Brandt, Will Selva, Tom Pelissero and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara discuss surprising comments from Davante Adams about the Packers and Jordan Love.  The crew debates which player could get their first Super Bowl this season and Tom explains why it could be Matt Ryan with the Colts.  We explore the biggest question marks in the NFC East before getting the Top 5 Underrated WR's in NFL history.  We wrap up the week with Kyle's invite to The Belmont Stakes and he plans on wearing.

item.itunes:title: Cooper Kupp Contract, Carson Wentz future, Bucs Questions, Fields v Wilson, and Eagles vs Cowboys
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the Rams extending Cooper Kupp's contract. Hosts Kyle Brandt, Will Selva, Tom Pelissero and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara discuss how the Rams can still improve going forward.  After an update on the Browns QBs, we turn our attention to Carson Wentz and what he needs to do in Washington.  The table debates the biggest question marks around the Bucs and Tom wonders when Brady will see a drop off in skill.  Will Justin Fields or Zach Wilson make the biggest jump as a 2nd year NFL QB? Plus, Throwdown Thursday asks if Davante Adams or Cooper Kupp has more yards and who has the better skill positions, the Eagles or Cowboys?

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:

item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins analyzing how competitive the New England Patriots will be next season.  Hosts Peter Schrager, Rachel Bonnetta, Adam Rank and former NFL DB DeAngelo Hall share their take on how far Mac Jones can take the Patriots in his second season. Next, DeAngelo picks his “decade dynamos” from the 2010’s and then the GMFB crew picks their five fastest players in NFL history. The GMFB crew finishes up being joined by former NFL TE and FOX analyst Greg Olson and he shares his thoughts on tight ends being underpaid, the bright future for Kyle Pitts and then Greg gives an update on his son a year after his heart transplant.

item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with pressure on Giants QB Daniel Jones. Hosts Peter Schrager, Kyle Brandt, Jane Slater, and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson put together a checklist of 'needs' for Jones to remain in NYC.  With The Preakness on Saturday, the crew gives their dark horse MVP picks before discussing the viral video of ambidextrous QB Mikey Gow. We hear Joe Burrow explain how a Kurt Warner soundbite helped him celebrate following a loss in the Super Bowl.  The table debates if Lamar Jackson should push harder for a contract extension then we celebrate Kyle's son getting his first hit in Little League.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Are Eagles offseason winners? Chargers expectations; NFL Draft Lottery? Unanswered questions
item.itunes:title: Are Eagles offseason winners? Chargers expectations; NFL Draft Lottery? Unanswered questions
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins looking at the offseason moves made by the Philadelphia Eagles. Hosts Jane Slater, Peter Schrager, Kyle Brandt, and Super Bowl champion Michael Robinson explain why the Philadelphia Eagles are the winners of the offseason, with one of the hosts providing caution. Next, the GMFB crew gets into “we in or we out” where they discuss if the NFL should institute a draft lottery for the NFL, similar to the NBA. Later, they share what they want answered in 2023, with Peter addressing the concern about Aaron Rodgers’ #1 receiver and Michael dives into the future of Kyler Murray and gas prices. The show finishes up discussing if the Los Angeles Chargers should be a playoff team.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Bleep happens; Top 5 Brady quotes; Questionable offenses; Jim McMahon
item.itunes:title: Bleep happens; Top 5 Brady quotes; Questionable offenses; Jim McMahon
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins looking at how likely it is for the Cincinnati Bengals to get back to the Super Bowl.  Hosts Jane Slater, Peter Schrager, Kyle Brandt, and Super Bowl champion Michael Robinson share their take on the likelihood the Bengals get back to the big game. Next, Kyle runs through his top-5 favorite Tom Brady quotes and the GMFB crew shares their take on Tom Brady’s future in the FOX booth. Later, they discuss which offense has the most unanswered questions and Peter explains why the Packers offense is the biggest questions mark. The show finishes up being joined by retired quarterback and two-time Super Bowl champion Jim McMahon and he talks about his playing style, the historic 85’ Bears team, and why he wore his Chicago Bears uniform when he visited the White House as a Super Bowl Champion with the Green Bay Packers.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: NFL Schedule release; Brady vs. Mahomes; Kay's finale
item.itunes:title: NFL Schedule release; Brady vs. Mahomes; Kay's finale
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins looking at the NFL schedule release.  Hosts Kay Adams, Peter Schrager, Kyle Brandt, and former Super Bowl champion Shaun O’Hara explore which non-division winner deserves the most primetime games. Next, Peter and Kyle share if the Jets will have over or under 2.5 primetime games, Kyle explains why the Bills will have over 5.5 primetime games, and then they breakdown the Buccaneers vs. Chiefs game announced for next season. Later, they run through five burning questions about the schedule release and then Shaun explains why he’s rooting for Dan Campbell. The GMFB show finishes up with Kay Adams officially announcing that tomorrow’s going to be her last show.

item.content:encoded:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with hope for the Dolphins in the AFC East. Hosts Kay Adams, Peter Schrager, Kyle Brandt and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara discuss Miami's moves and how it helps against the Bills and Patriots.  The table feels there needs to be a big jump from Justin Fields for the Bears, but there really is no bigger QB question than what the Seahawks are doing.  We learn the Week 2 Monday Night Football Doubleheader before asking the crew which team should have the most prime time appearances and explaining why it's not the Chiefs.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins looking at the starting quarterbacks responsibility to mentor the future starting quarterback. Hosts Kay Adams, Peter Schrager, Tom Pelissero and 2-time Super Bowl champion Torrey Smith react to Ryan Tannehill’s comments about his role in mentoring Malik Willis. Then the GMFB crew dives into what they liked the most from the NFC West teams in the draft. Later, Peter and Torrey deliver their top-3 underrated receivers which includes a Buccaneers and Panthers WR as their most underrated and then Tom reacts to Russell Wilson’s positive and powering approach he’s bringing to the Denver Broncos. They finish up discussing the quarterback competition between Kenny Pickett and Mitch Trubisky in Pittsburgh.

item.itunes:title: International Games Announced, Russell Wilson, Doug Pederson, and Osi Umenyiora
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the International NFL Games being revealed throughout the show.  Hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara discuss the Seahawks and Buccaneers playing in Munich with Tom Brady in the spotlight.  Onto London where three games will be played: Vikings-Saints, Giants-Packers, and Broncos-Jaguars. We speak with Jags HC Doug Pederson and Broncos QB Russell Wilson about their matchup.  The crew also announces the 49ers-Cardinals matchup in Mexico before exploring the international growth of the NFL with Super Bowl champ Osi Umenyiora. 

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:

Hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, and former Super Bowl champion Shaun O’Hara address how the DeAndre Hopkins suspension will impact Kyler Murray. item.title: Best Team Drafts, Packers late WR picks, Mayfield options, Nate Burleson, and Honey Badger news!
item.itunes:title: Best Team Drafts, Packers late WR picks, Mayfield options, Nate Burleson, and Honey Badger news!
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with a complete recap of the 2022 NFL Draft.  Hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara discuss the teams that had the best overall picks. The table looks at individual players that are set up to succeed with their new teams before turning attention to the nine QB's that were selected.  The Packers finally took a WR late, but can he immediately produce on the field?  Kyle thinks the Seahawks should be interested in Baker Mayfield, but wonders why there's not any support around the league for the QB.  Nate Burleson drops by to talk Draft and Kyle's pick for the Bills.  Plus, we get breaking news on Tyrann Mathieu to the Saints.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: NFL Draft Round One, Kenny Pickett to Pittsburgh, Packers still need WR, Who won Round One?
item.itunes:title: NFL Draft Round One, Kenny Pickett to Pittsburgh, Packers still need WR, Who won Round One?
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with Round One of the NFL Draft.  Hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Fmr NFL QB Matt Cassel discuss the lack of QB's taken and the impressive picks from both the Jets and Giants. Kenny Pickett to the Steelers is the only first round QB taken while the Packers still didn't find any WR help on day one.  The table looks at the biggest picks made and the biggest head scratchers before asking who own the first night.  We wrap up with a quick look at Round Two and the remaining talent on the board.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Biggest questions in NFL Draft; Final Mock Draft; Giants or Jets?
item.itunes:title: Biggest questions in NFL Draft; Final Mock Draft; Giants or Jets?
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins setting the stage for the NFL Draft. Hosts Kay Adams, Peter Schrager, Kyle Brandt and former NFL QB Matt Cassel provide their biggest questions hours before the NFL draft. Then Peter Schrager shares his final mock draft which includes two teams trading up for wide receivers. Later, the GMFB crew discusses which team needs an A+ draft. They finish up being joined by insiders Judy Battista and Mike Giardi for insights on who has a better chance of turning it around: the Jets or Giants.

item.itunes:title: Jaguars Options at #1, Highest ceilings, Lack of QB buzz, and Which team will surprise everyone?

item.title: Best scenario for NY Jets; Lions fate at #2; Packers needs; NFL prospects Haskell Garrett and Travon Walker
item.itunes:title: Best scenario for NY Jets; Lions fate at #2; Packers needs; NFL prospects Haskell Garrett and Travon Walker
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins exploring how the New York Jets should attack the draft.  Hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, former NFL QB Matt Cassel, and former NFL executive Scott Pioli share their analysis on what would be an A+ draft for the Jets. Then the GMFB crew pretends to be the decision makers in the Detroit Lions front office and decide the fate of the Lions at #2. Later, they share their take on what the Green Bay Packers should do in the draft. They’re joined by NFL prospect Haskell Garrett and he talks about getting back on the field after a shooting incident in college and what it means to him to have the NFL draft in Las Vegas. They finish up being joined by potential #1 overall pick Travon Walker and he shares his thoughts on being a national champion, why he deserves to be the #1 overall pick and who he’d love to sack in the NFL.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Draft Week Underway, QB Draft Questions, Jaguars pressure, Deebo Samuel offers?
item.itunes:title: Draft Week Underway, QB Draft Questions, Jaguars pressure, Deebo Samuel offers?
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the 2022 Draft Week getting underway in Las Vegas! Hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Fmr NFL QB Matt Cassel discuss the Jaguars needing to hit, but how the Jets and Giants have a lot riding on this Draft.  Peter questions how many QB's will be taken in the first round of the Draft before we look at the players that will make an immediate impact for their new teams.  We look at how Deebo Samuel's trade request could have teams making offers on Thursday rather than relying on the Draft to fill their needs.  Peter names a wildcard team that could be a perfect fit for Samuel.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.itunes:title: Deebo Samuel to Jets? Mock Draft continues, Cardinals on Kyler Murray, Bills SB or bust, and Who goes #1?

Hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara question when it's Super Bowl or bust in Buffalo.  Peter helps us look at Draft questions that are still being pondered by teams, including who the Jaguars will take with #1.  The table questions what path the Panthers will take at QB because Kyle doesn't really like any of the options. We look at which NFL teams should be taking the biggest swings during the Draft before previewing Peter's 2.0 mock draft coming on Tuesday.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.itunes:title: Should Baker Mayfield feel disrespected? Expectations for Derek Carr; Tweets of RAGE! NFL Draft prospect, Zion Johnson
item.description:
The latest edition of The Good Morning Football Podcast reacts to Baker Mayfied’s latest comments on feeling disrespected by the Cleveland Browns. Hosts Kay Adams, Peter Schrager, Kyle Brandt, and former Super Bowl champion, Michael Robinson explain why Mayfield’s comments are odd. Then they get into “Tweets of Rage” which is a funny bit on twitters reaction to some of the best draft picks ever. Later, they discuss if Derek Carr will be a top-5 quarterback in the AFC and they finish up being joined by NFL Draft prospect, Zion Johnson, and he shares who pushed him into playing football and then he explains his unique way of lifting weights.

item.itunes:title: Dwayne Haskins death, QB at #2? New head coaches, Jets and Giants hope, and Rams challenges
item.description:
This edition of The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the shocking death of QB Dwayne Haskins.  Hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson reflect on reactions from around the NFL.  The Draft is a couple weeks away and we debate if the Lions should be looking for a QB.  With all the new head coaches in the NFL, which one do you buy into the most?  The Jets and Giants both need improvements, but which team really needs to have their picks be successful?  We wrap with Aaron Donald's recent workout video and the biggest challenge facing the Rams this season.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:

item.title: Team to Beat in AFC? Tiger Woods or Tom Brady? Mock Draft 1.0
item.itunes:title: Team to Beat in AFC? Tiger Woods or Tom Brady? Mock Draft 1.0
item.description:
The latest edition of The Good Morning Football Podcast explores where the Buffalo Bills rank in the AFC after their monster offseason. Hosts Jane Slater, Peter Schrager, Kyle Brandt, and former Pro Bowler Dante Hall debate which team is the one to beat in the AFC. Then they examine if Josh Allen and Stefon Diggs or Derek Carr and Davante Adams will be a more lethal duo; they discuss if Tom Brady or Tiger Woods has had the more impressive career; and Peter Schrager delivers his mock draft 1.0. They finish up with suggestions for available free agents like Odell Beckham Jr, Calais Campbell, and Stephon Gilmore.

item.description:

item.title: Bobby Wagner to Rams, Best NFC Team? Eagles OT Jordan Mailata, and NFL TV pitches
item.itunes:title: Bobby Wagner to Rams, Best NFC Team? Eagles OT Jordan Mailata, and NFL TV pitches
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast takes a closer look at Bobby Wagner signing with the Rams.  Hosts Rachel Bonnetta, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara believe we're seeing every contender load up their rosters and discuss Wagner become a rival of the Seahawks.  Moving to the NFL Draft, Peter is looking forward to Oregon's Pro Day and the performance of Kayvon Thibodeaux.  The table asks which team really needs to have a perfect Draft.  After looking at the top NFC teams, Peter wants to know if Matt LaFleur should be looking for a big deal right now.  Eagles OT Jordan Mailata drops by to discuss his journey from Australia, to the NFL, and now to 'The Masked Singer'.  We wrap up the week with Rachel's TV pitches based on Baker Mayfield, new Giants' HC Brian Daboll, the Chiefs and Bengals!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Bruce Arians to Front Office, Bowles now HC; DK Metcalf trade possibilities; Desmond Ridder
item.itunes:title: Bruce Arians to Front Office, Bowles now HC; DK Metcalf trade possibilities; Desmond Ridder
item.description:
The latest edition of The Good Morning Football Podcast provides instant insight into the breaking news that Bruce Arians is stepping away from head coaching and stepping into a front office role with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. Hosts Rachel Bonnetta, Peter Schrager, Kyle Brandt, and Super Bowl champion Shaun O’Hara share their thoughts on what led to Bruce Arians shifting roles and Todd Bowles becoming the new head coach. Then they started a segment called ‘Gladness or Sadness’ and they share their emotions about DK Metcalf potentially being traded and Chris Rock’s ticket prices soaring. Peter Schrager leads a mixed bag trivia focused on the NFL Draft and they finish up being joined by future NFL quarterback Desmond Ridder and he shares what it was like to take down Notre Dame last season and what the pre-draft experience feels like.

item.title: NFL rule changes, Patriots faith, Lamar Jackson contract, and 49ers keep Garoppolo?
item.itunes:title: NFL rule changes, Patriots faith, Lamar Jackson contract, and 49ers keep Garoppolo?
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with rules chance coming from the NFL Team meetings.  Hosts Rachel Bonnetta, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Fmr Pro Bowl WR Dante Hall discuss the push for diversity in the NFL along with a playoff overtime rule change.  Rachel explains why she has faith in the upcoming year for the Patriots before we move onto Lamar Jackson's contract situation with the Ravens.  Without an immediate trade partner for Jimmy Garoppolo, could the 49ers entertain keeping him as a backup for Trey Lance? We wrap up with a story from Dante about an amazing experience with soon to be Hall of Famer Dick Vermeil. 

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:
This week of The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the NFL Owners meetings in Palm Beach, Florida.  Hosts Rachel Bonnetta, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Fmr Pro Bowl WR Dante Hall discuss the topics being explored and what else they would like other teams and front offices to do in these meetings. Browns Head Coach Kevin Stafanski addresses the media to discuss Baker Mayfield and the future plan for Deshaun Watson.  After hearing HC Mike McDaniel discuss the Dolphins plan, the table gives expectations for Miami this season.  The Raiders have all the pieces, but is the top of the AFC possible for this team? We wrap up with other questions we have about the upcoming year in the AFC.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.content:encoded:
This week of The Good Morning Football Podcast begins with the NFL Owners meetings in Palm Beach, Florida.  Hosts Rachel Bonnetta, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Fmr Pro Bowl WR Dante Hall discuss the topics being explored and what else they would like other teams and front offices to do in these meetings. Browns Head Coach Kevin Stafanski addresses the media to discuss Baker Mayfield and the future plan for Deshaun Watson.  After hearing HC Mike McDaniel discuss the Dolphins plan, the table gives expectations for Miami this season.  The Raiders have all the pieces, but is the top of the AFC possible for this team? We wrap up with other questions we have about the upcoming year in the AFC.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
The latest edition of The Good Morning Football Podcast dives into how the Tyreek Hill trade will affect the Miami Dolphins and impact the Kansas City Chiefs. They finish up being joined by Levi Wallace who just signed a contract with the Pittsburgh Steelers and he shares how he went from undrafted rookie to starting corner and he explains why he decided to walk on at Alabama.

item.title: Matt Ryan traded to Indy; Can Colts dethrone Titans? 28-3 narrative; Kenny Pickett's hand size; Mike Singletary
item.itunes:title: Matt Ryan traded to Indy; Can Colts dethrone Titans? 28-3 narrative; Kenny Pickett's hand size; Mike Singletary
item.description:
The latest edition of The Good Morning Football Podcast examines how much value Matt Ryan will bring to the Indianapolis Colts following his trade from the Atlanta Falcons.  Hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Tom Pelissero, and former Pro Bowl RB Maurice Jones-Drew look at how the Matt Ryan led Indianapolis Colts matchup against the Tennessee Titans in the AFC South. Then they share their thoughts on how much of a big deal Kenny Pickett’s hand size is; Tom Pelissero shares how these past two weeks have been the craziest stretch of his career; Kyle Brandt explains why he wants the Matt Ryan 28-3 narrative to end; and MJD provides insight on how future draftees should enter their pro day. They finish up being joined by Mike Singletary and he shares stories about Walter Payton and then he explains why the 85’ Chicago Bears have stood the test of time.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Deshaun Watson contract shock, Packers WR options, Mayfield market value, and Top AFC QB's
item.itunes:title: Deshaun Watson contract shock, Packers WR options, Mayfield market value, and Top AFC QB's
item.description:
The latest edition of The Good Morning Football Podcast explores Deshaun Watson signing with the Browns.  Hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Tom Pelissero, and Fmr Pro Bowl RB Maurice Jones-Drew discuss the eye-popping guaranteed money, the Browns statement and how this could affect all contracts moving forward.  With Davante Adams going to the Raiders, the Packers are looking for a WR1 and we discuss what options can fill that void.  The crew looks at the market value for Baker Mayfield and how it compares to Jimmy Garoppolo and Matt Ryan potentially being available.  MJD gives his Top 5 AFC QB's and explains why Russell Wilson didn't make the list.  Plus, which team is winning the off-season?

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Packers trade Davante Adams to Raiders, Baker Mayfield wants out, Trubisky expectations, Green Bay WR options
item.itunes:title: Packers trade Davante Adams to Raiders, Baker Mayfield wants out, Trubisky expectations, Green Bay WR options
item.description:
The latest edition of The Good Morning Football Podcast kicks off with Davante Adams being traded by the Packers to the Raiders. Hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara discuss what this means for both teams. The Raiders are stacked and the Packers will be looking to replace a top tier WR. The Browns and Baker Mayfield could be facing an awkward showdown if the QB is forced to come back to Cleveland, meanwhile Kay thinks Mitch Trubisky and the Steelers will be in the mix Back to the Packers, Kyle thinks fans who feel Green Bay will fall without Adams are going to be completely disappointed. The crew also hopes to have an answer on the Deshaun Watson questions by Monday.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: A Baker Mayfield message, Deshaun Watson interest, Matt Ryan to Colts? Randy Gregory to Broncos, Von Miller options, and Free Agency possibilities
item.itunes:title: A Baker Mayfield message, Deshaun Watson interest, Matt Ryan to Colts? Randy Gregory to Broncos, Von Miller options, and Free Agency possibilities
item.description:
The new league year kicks off for the NFL in the latest edition of The Good Morning Football Podcast. Hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara discuss the message posted by Baker Mayfield on social media and what it means for his future in Cleveland. As interest in Deshaun Watson is growing, the Falcons could have Matt Ryan looking for his next opportunity. With Randy Gregory going to the Broncos, could Von Miller be headed to the Cowboys? Plenty will be happening in free agency, but the crew explores who has been the most head-scratching team so far? We wrap up looking at potential deals that could happen very quickly throughout the day.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Tom Brady Returns, Deshaun Watson options, Davante Adams decision, Kirk Cousins deal, Free Agency frenzy
item.itunes:title: Tom Brady Returns, Deshaun Watson options, Davante Adams decision, Kirk Cousins deal, Free Agency frenzy
item.description:
Tom Brady's return highlights the latest edition of The Good Morning Football Podcast. Hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara discuss Brady's decision to play and what went into the decision. Talks around Deshaun Watson have started and it looks like there are 2 teams making offers for the franchise QB. Davante Adams informed the Packers he won't play on the franchise tag, so what can Aaron Rodgers do? Kirk Cousins has a new deal with the Vikings and Peter explains why he thinks this could be a bargain. We explore what teams will look like after Free Agency and ask who will be the next breakout defensive player in the NFL.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Khalil Mack to Chargers, Impact to AFC West, Steelers QB search, Mitch Trubisky and Marcus Mariota futures, and Free Agency steals
item.itunes:title: Khalil Mack to Chargers, Impact to AFC West, Steelers QB search, Mitch Trubisky and Marcus Mariota futures, and Free Agency steals
item.description:
In the latest edition of The Good Morning Football Podcast, Hosts Kay Adams, Mike Garafolo and Super Bowl Champions LeSean McCoy and Shaun O'Hara discuss a trade sending Khalil Mack to the Chargers and how it would affect the AFC West. Are the Chiefs still the favorites in the division with Mahomes? While it may be a good move for the Bears, Kay wishes the franchise had gotten more in return. The Steelers are in the QB market and the crew wonders if Kenny Pickett could be their target in the Draft. Mitch Trubisky and Marcus Mariota are two QBs that will get significant interest in free agency, but who will be the biggest overall steals in Free Agency.

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Mike Garafolo, and Super Bowl champions LeSean McCoy and Shaun O'Hara share their differing opinions about the Indianapolis Colts trading Carson Wentz to the Washington Commanders. Mike Garafolo runs through under-the-radar free agents, the crew debates who the Colts should target as their next quarterback and then they debate which team should be the favorites in the NFC next season. item.title: Rogers staying-Russell going, Davante Adams Franchise Tag, Watson and Garoppolo future, and NFL Prospect Nick Cross
item.itunes:title: Rogers staying-Russell going, Davante Adams Franchise Tag, Watson and Garoppolo future, and NFL Prospect Nick Cross
item.description:
An epic day for the NFL as two marquee QB's make headlines. Hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and 2x Super Bowl Champion LeSean McCoy discuss Russell Wilson being traded to Denver and Aaron Rodgers staying in Green Bay. Peter credits the Broncos for keeping the discussions on this deal quiet for some time. Kyle thinks Rodgers made the easiest decision, but now needs to win another Super Bowl. Now that Rodgers and Wilson's destinations are solidified, Peter thinks some attention will turn to the future of Deshaun Watson and what teams could have interest after a court date on Friday. The table also debates if Washington should sign Jimmy Garoppolo. NFL Prospect Nick Cross drops by to discuss his :40 time and tells GMs why they should draft him.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and 2x Super Bowl Champion LeSean McCoy discuss which player they think 'won' the Combine. Kenny Pickett, Travon Walker, and Malik Willis all got high scores from the desk. After giving Report Card grades for the AFC South, we zoom in on Aaron Rodgers being torn about his playing future and possibly playing for a few franchise. We look at the teams that we learned a lot about from the Combine including the Jaguars and Dolphins looking to turn things around. Plus, LeSean gives us his favorite Combine memory from 2009.

item.itunes:title: QB's shine at Combine, Most NFL potential, WR depth at Combine, NFC West Report Cards, and Peter's Combine perspective
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Peter Schrager, James Palmer, and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson discuss night one of the NFL Scouting Combine and debate which QB stood out the most. Malik Willis put on quite a show and there was a lot of talk surrounding Kenny Pickett and his hand size. We turn to current NFL QB's to ask which young arm has the most potential looking forward and what they need to reach that potential. Back to the Combine, we examine the performances of the WR's and how the Draft could be affected with the depth of the position. The crew wraps up their Report Cards with the NFC West and what areas they can give an 'A' to each team. Peter will continue his reporting at the Combine through the weekend and describes how different and helpful it is talking to coaches and team execs when they're not behind a podium or in game mode during the season.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Combine standouts; Mike McDaniel; NFC North Report Card; Mike Vrabel; Nathaniel Hackett
item.itunes:title: Combine standouts; Mike McDaniel; NFC North Report Card; Mike Vrabel; Nathaniel Hackett
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Peter Schrager, James Palmer, and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson start the show sharing which players at the NFL combine they're most excited to watch. Then Peter Schrager is joined by Miami Dolphins head coach Mike McDaniel and he shares where they're at with Tua and how he plans to utilize Jaylen Waddle. They also share their report cards for the NFC North and then Peter Schrager is joined by Tennessee Titans head coach Mike Vrabel and he shares how they're evaluating Ryan Tannehill this offseason and why the team did such a great job handling adversity last season. The show finishes up with Denver Broncos head coach Nathaniel Hackett joining Peter Schrager and he shares how they're evaluating their quarterback position and what he thinks about Aaron Rodgers.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Bucs without Brady? AFC East Report Cards, 49ers GM John Lynch, Cardinals respond to Kyler, and SB Champion Andrew Whitworth
item.itunes:title: Bucs without Brady? AFC East Report Cards, 49ers GM John Lynch, Cardinals respond to Kyler, and SB Champion Andrew Whitworth
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, James Palmer, and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson throw it out to Peter Schrager, who is in Indianapolis for the Combine. We'll be hearing from plenty of GM's, Coaches, and Players as the media availability starts today. The Bucs are leaving the door open for Tom Brady but what is their best realistic QB option in the near future? The crew gives report cards for the AFC East before being joined by 49ers GM John Lynch, who gives an update on the team's situations with Jimmy Garoppolo and Trey Lance. The Cardinals have a response to the letter put out by Kyler Murray's agent, plus we hear from Super Bowl Champion Andrew Whitworth about the Rams parade and his upcoming decision on his future.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: NFL Combine Updates, Rams going back to back? AFC West Report Cards, Aaron Rodgers and Kyler Murray futures, and Nate Burleson
item.itunes:title: NFL Combine Updates, Rams going back to back? AFC West Report Cards, Aaron Rodgers and Kyler Murray futures, and Nate Burleson
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Peter Schrager, Kimmi Chex, James Palmer and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson discuss prospects preparing for the NFL Combine and what rule changes could be happening for next season. With so many questions around the team, we ask if the Rams are capable of back to back Super Bowl runs. The crew hands out report cards for the AFC West before debating whether or not Aaron Rodgers could end up playing in the division. Kyler Murray's agent posts a letter to the Cardinals on social media and the desk wonders if it was the right move. Nate Burleson drops by with his thoughts on the Murray statement and Sean McVay staying with the Rams.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Aaron Rodgers future, Rams losing coaches, Vikings decisions, Kyler Murray questions and Nate Burleson
item.itunes:title: Aaron Rodgers future, Rams losing coaches, Vikings decisions, Kyler Murray questions and Nate Burleson
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara discuss the importance of Aaron Rodgers future and how it could be the most important story in the offseason. Sean McVay is losing several coaches from his staff, how will that effect his plan moving forward. The Vikings have an interesting offseason ahead and the crew wonders how the younger head coach and GM will look at Kirk Cousins and his contract. Kyler Murray and the Cardinals need to put all this speculation to rest. Could we see several QB's traded in the coming months? Plus, Nate Burleson joins us to talk Aaron Rodgers as well as his interviews with Dr. Dre and Snoop Dogg.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Rams plan to 'Run it Back'; Better Super Bowl pass: Eli vs. Stafford; Eric Weddle
item.itunes:title: Rams plan to 'Run it Back'; Better Super Bowl pass: Eli vs. Stafford; Eric Weddle
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara react to the Los Angeles Rams Super Bowl parade and discuss the Rams chances to win back-to-back Super Bowls. Then they compare the Eli Manning pass to Mario Manningham to the Matthew Stafford pass to Cooper Kupp; and they finish up being joined by the Los Angeles Rams Super Bowl winning safety Eric Weddle and he describes the past 60 days of his life; he shares how he pushed through his injury in the Super Bowl; and then he finishes up talking about the Rams leadership.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Parade Day for Rams, Teams that should go all in, Burrow top QB in AFC? Rodgers staying in GB? Sean McVay future, and Bucs after Brady
item.itunes:title: Parade Day for Rams, Teams that should go all in, Burrow top QB in AFC? Rodgers staying in GB? Sean McVay future, and Bucs after Brady
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara hear some Super Bowl calls from around the world before discussing what other NFL teams should take the same path as the Rams and go 'all in'. We debate if Joe Burrow should be considered the top AFC QB right now and if Aaron Rodgers should consider an offer to stay in Green Bay. Rams HC Sean McVay hasn't quieted speculation about his future, so the crew asks what's next in LA? What were the gutsiest calls we've seen in Super Bowl history, plus we start to look ahead by asking how the Bucs will move on from Tom Brady.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Will Bengals be back? Aaron Donald's future; Stafford's no-look pass; Super Bowl parties; Matt Gay
item.itunes:title: Will Bengals be back? Aaron Donald's future; Stafford's no-look pass; Super Bowl parties; Matt Gay
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and former Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara examine the state of the Cincinnati Bengals and explore the likelihood that they'll be back in the Super Bowl. Then they break down Matthew Stafford's no-look pass to Cooper Kupp; they're joined by Scott Pioli and he shares his experience at Super Bowl parties and explains how soon coaches and GM's get back to work after a Super Bowl; and they share their thoughts on the future of Aaron Donald. They finish up being joined by Los Angeles Rams kicker Matt Gay and he gives insights into what the last 48 hours have been like; he shares what it was like to kick the game winning field goal against his former team, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers; and then he explains how important it is to live in the moment.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Rams win the Super Bowl, Cooper Kupp is MVP, Nate Burleson on Stafford and OBJ, Bengals future, and Halftime Show
item.itunes:title: Rams win the Super Bowl, Cooper Kupp is MVP, Nate Burleson on Stafford and OBJ, Bengals future, and Halftime Show
item.description:
In this Super Bowl edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson discuss the Rams win over the Bengals. Cooper Kupp wins the MVP award and Aaron Donald sealed the victory. Nate Burleson drops by to highlight Matt Stafford's performance and the future of Odell Beckham Jr. Peter tells Bengals fans not to hang onto issues with the refs because the future with Burrow and Chase is so bright. The crew also gives their thoughts on the star-studded Halftime Show.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Earnin' It - The Greatest Show on Earth with Questlove and Dionne Harmon
item.itunes:title: Earnin' It - The Greatest Show on Earth with Questlove and Dionne Harmon
item.description:
On the most recent episode of Earnin' It, we dive into a brief history of the hottest 12 minutes in television: the Super Bowl Halftime Show, featuring U2, Prince, and Lady Gaga. Last year, Executive Producer Dionne Harmon became the first Black woman to lead the show — and she’s back this season to light up Sofi Stadium with Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Kendrick Lamar, and Mary J. Blige. Get a behind the scenes look at what goes into choosing the artists, developing the vision, and building (and tearing down) the elaborate set in a matter of minutes.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Aaron Rodgers wins MVP in NFL Honors, New HOF Class, Kirk Cousins, Ron Rivera, Super Bowl Picks, Sean Payton and Mac Jones
item.itunes:title: Aaron Rodgers wins MVP in NFL Honors, New HOF Class, Kirk Cousins, Ron Rivera, Super Bowl Picks, Sean Payton and Mac Jones
item.description:
In this Super Week Edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Fmr NFL DB DeAngelo Hall discuss Aaron Rodgers winning MVP as part of the NFL Honors awarded last night along with a new class of Hall of Famers. Vikings QB Kirk Cousins talks about his season and the future of Aaron Rodgers. The crew asks about the brightest stars coming in the Super Bowl before talking coaching diversity and the Washington Commanders with Ron Rivera. We get a visit from Sean Payton, who talks about his future and memories of John Madden. After a week of analysis, we finally get Super Bowl predictions and wrap up with Mac Jones who explains why he isn't making a pick.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: What would a Super Bowl mean for Bengals and Rams? Who deserves NFL MVP? Troy Aikman
item.itunes:title: What would a Super Bowl mean for Bengals and Rams? Who deserves NFL MVP? Troy Aikman
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Colleen Wolfe, Peter Schrager, former NFL DB DeAngelo Hall, and Super Bowl champion Shaun O'Hara explore how massive a Super Bowl title would mean for the career of Joe Burrow this early in his career and then they react to Roger Goodell's press conference, specifically on the league problem with minority head coaching hires. Also, they share their thoughts on who deserves the NFL's MVP award and what a Super Bowl title would mean for the Los Angeles Rams. They finish up being joined by Troy Aikman and he shares his thoughts on his relationship with Matthew Stafford, the edge of Joe Burrow, and the Cowboys.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: How Bengals can win, New Texans HC Lovie Smith, Keys for the Rams, plus Hall of Famer Anthony Munoz and Geoff Schwartz
item.itunes:title: How Bengals can win, New Texans HC Lovie Smith, Keys for the Rams, plus Hall of Famer Anthony Munoz and Geoff Schwartz
item.description:
In this Super Week Edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Fmr NFL DB DeAngelo Hall discuss the reasons the Bengals could win despite the Rams having the better team on paper. New Texans HC Lovie Smith talks about diversity in the coaching ranks before looking at the future of his team along with Deshaun Watson. The crew looks for the 'X-factor' in the game then asks what would be the worst case scenario for the Rams. Hall of Famer Anthony Munoz drops by to talk about his Bengals and we hear from Fmr NFL OG Geoff Schwartz.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Why are the Bengals so captivating? Do Rams have huge advantage? Calvin Johnson; Charles Woodson
item.itunes:title: Why are the Bengals so captivating? Do Rams have huge advantage? Calvin Johnson; Charles Woodson
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and former NFL DB DeAngelo Hall start the show examining why this Cincinnati Bengals team is so captivating and how much of an advantage the Los Angeles Rams have playing in their home stadium. Then they're joined by Calvin Johnson and he shares his thoughts on his former teammate Matthew Stafford, Cooper Kupp, which team has the better receiving group, and how Sean McVay beat Calvin Johnson in high school for athlete of the year. They finish up being joined by Charles Woodson and he shares his thoughts on the 'tuck rule', the similarities between the Packers Super Bowl winning team and the Bengals, why the Packers should consider trading Aaron Rodgers, and how he prepared against elite wide receivers during his time in the league.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Super Bowl Week Underway, Pro Bowl madness, Burrow Press Conference, Dolphins hire 49ers OC, NFL Dream Teams? Plus Cris Collinsworth
item.itunes:title: Super Bowl Week Underway, Pro Bowl madness, Burrow Press Conference, Dolphins hire 49ers OC, NFL Dream Teams? Plus Cris Collinsworth
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Fmr NFL DB DeAngelo Hall discuss Super Bowl Week getting started and the atmosphere in Los Angeles. After a Pro Bowl recap, we explore how Super Bowl experience and a win could take Joe Burrow from being a star to a superstar. We go in-depth on the Dolphins hiring 49ers OC Mike McDaniel as their new head coach and discuss if 'Dream Teams' could be the next trend in the NFL. After listening into Joe Burrow's press conference, we wrap up with NBC's Cris Collinsworth who talks about calling the game and a possible Bengals victory!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

After listening into Joe Burrow's press conference, we wrap up with NBC's Cris Collinsworth who talks about calling the game and a possible Bengals victory!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, Jane Slater, and Hall of Famer Cris Carter discuss the Bengals just being in the Super Bowl is an amazing storyline. The Jaguars have hired Super Bowl Champion Doug Pederson as their next head coach while an announcement from the Saints is expected soon. Cris explains why the NFL still needs to do a better job in hiring minority head coaches. The crew wonders how much experience in the postseason and the Super Bowl will play into which team ends up winning the championship. Nate Burleson drops by to discuss his awkward meeting with Michael Jordan and what he expects from Matt Stafford and the Rams.

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Hall of Famer Cris Carter explore how the Bengals turned their franchise around and were rewarded with a Super Bowl appearance. Brian Flores alleges racial discrimination and unethical practices from several NFL teams. The Vikings will interview Jim Harbaugh but does that mean a deal for him to return to the NFL is close? Tom Brady walks away from the NFL but the crew wonders if Tampa remains a contender and who else will be affected by Brady's decision. Washington has chosen their new team name and who will be Jimmy Garoppolo's new team come next season?

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Hall of Famer Cris Carter react to the breaking news announced by Tom Brady that he's officially retiring from the NFL. Then they share their thoughts on why everybody is fascinated with Joe Burrow and how Justin Fields fits in with the new look Chicago Bears front office. They finish up discussing what will make Josh McDaniels successful with the Las Vegas Raiders and they're joined by New York Giants head coach Brian Daboll and he shares his thoughts on Daniel Jones, Josh Allen, and his expectation as the head coach for the Giants.

item.title: Bengals and Rams advance to the Super Bowl, Tom Brady's future, Giants and Raiders HC hires, and Nate Burleson
item.itunes:title: Bengals and Rams advance to the Super Bowl, Tom Brady's future, Giants and Raiders HC hires, and Nate Burleson
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Hall of Famer Cris Carter discuss the Bengals and Rams advancing to the Super Bowl. Matt Stafford continues to rewrite his story and change the legacy he carried from Detroit. Meanwhile, Joe Burrow is starting his legacy in amazing fashion with a Super Bowl trip after his second season. The 49ers and Chiefs are left with questions after both teams had victory within reach but faltered in the closing moments. The crew wants to give Tom Brady the proper send off, but realizes we haven't heard from him yet and may need to celebrate Brady all over again following an official announcement. The Giants and Raiders have hired new head coaches, plus Nate Burleson drops by to talk Brady and the Super Bowl matchup.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Hall of Famer Cris Carter discuss who will be the most fascinating player on Sunday. How can the Rams get over their mental hurdle against the 49ers? The crew looks at the Cowboys future and how Mike McCarthy feels about Sean Payton being an available option for Jerry Jones. We get picks for Bengals-Chiefs and 49ers-Rams along with predictions for how the games will play out. Plus, Nate Burleson talks about his former teammate Matt Stafford and his recent conversation with Antonio Brown.

item.title: Hackett to Broncos-what's it mean for Rodgers? Jimmy G or Stafford? Giants GM, Joe Schoen; 49ers linebacker, Fred Warner
item.itunes:title: Hackett to Broncos-what's it mean for Rodgers? Jimmy G or Stafford? Giants GM, Joe Schoen; 49ers linebacker, Fred Warner
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Peter Schrager, Kyle Brandt, and Hall of Famer Cris Carter examine how the Denver Broncos head coach hiring of Green Bay Packers offensive coordinator Nathaniel Hackett could impact the future of Aaron Rodgers. Then the panel debates which quarterback, Jimmy Garoppolo or Matthew Stafford, has the better story. They finish the show being joined by New York Giants general manager Joe Schoen and he shares his thoughts on the hiring process to become the GM, how the Buffalo Bills settled on picking Josh Allen, and what their plan is for Daniel Jones moving forward; and San Francisco 49ers linebacker Fred Warner and he shares his thoughts on winning in Green Bay, holding Green Bay's offense to only 10 points, being vulnerable earlier in the season, and facing the Los Angeles Rams for the third time this season.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com
