item.title: Sean Payton leaving the Saints, Championship Weekend Questions, Burrow vs Mahomes, Garoppolo vs Stafford, plus Melissa Etheridge
item.itunes:title: Sean Payton leaving the Saints, Championship Weekend Questions, Burrow vs Mahomes, Garoppolo vs Stafford, plus Melissa Etheridge
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Mike Garafolo, and Hall of Famer Cris Carter discuss Sean Payton stepping down from the Saints and looking forward to what's next for the coach. How long will retirement last before he's in front of a camera or coaching a team? The crew asks what the biggest question is heading into Championship Weekend and what a win would mean for each of the four remaining QB's. Mahomes and Burrow are playing for the crown of the best young QB while Garoppolo could be playing for next season and Stafford is playing for his legacy. Plus, we get a visit from Grammy and Academy Award winning artist Melissa Etheridge to talk about her hometown Chiefs.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Bengals game plan to upset Chiefs? Greatest game of all time? Future of Sean Payton? Changes to Overtime Rules?
item.itunes:title: Bengals game plan to upset Chiefs? Greatest game of all time? Future of Sean Payton? Changes to Overtime Rules?
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Hall of Famer Cris Carter detail how the Cincinnati Bengals can go into Kansas City and pull off the upset to advance to the Super Bowl. Then it's time for "We In or We Out" where they discuss if a divisional round playoff game has enough stakes to be the greatest game of all time and "Taco Bout It" where they talk about Josh Allen's maturity, the overtime rules, and the stars lost during the divisional round. They're joined by Buffalo Bills wide receiver Gabriel Davis and he talks about his 4-touchdown performance against the Chiefs, the Josh Allen experience, and getting ready for next season. They finish up with a discussion on the future of Sean Payton in New Orleans.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Best weekend of NFL EVER? Mahomes new nickname, Brady and Rodgers futures, Trust in Garoppolo and Burrow
item.itunes:title: Best weekend of NFL EVER? Mahomes new nickname, Brady and Rodgers futures, Trust in Garoppolo and Burrow
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Hall of Famer Cris Carter discuss what could've been the best weekend of football in the history of the NFL. The crew examines the QB play from all four teams while beginning to look at the futures of Tom Brady and Aaron Rodgers. It's time to trust Jimmy Garoppolo while Joe Burrow continues to be better than advertised. Nate Burleson joins the show to discuss Bills-Chiefs coming down to overtime, Tom Brady's future and his continued respect for Matt Stafford. We wrap by delivering Game Balls for the Divisional Round Playoff games.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: NFL Playoffs Divisional Round, QB pressure, Brightest stars, Picks that could change? Plus Nate Burleson on Derrick Henry and Deebo Samuel
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson dive into the Divisional Round of NFL Playoffs looking at which QB has the most to gain or lose this weekend. The most impactful game could be in Lambeau where both Aaron Rodgers and Jimmy Garoppolo's future could be affected by the outcome. Kyle has a surprise pick for the player that needs to shine the brightest this weekend for their team. The crew makes their picks for the four games, but Kay isn't so sure that these picks won't change before kickoff. Nate Burleson drops by to talk Derrick Henry's return and Deebo Samuel.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: How can Rams defeat Brady? Can Packers defense stop 49ers? Michael Buffer; CJ Uzomah; AJ Hawk; Ryan Leaf
item.itunes:title: How can Rams defeat Brady? Can Packers defense stop 49ers? Michael Buffer; CJ Uzomah; AJ Hawk; Ryan Leaf
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson explore how the Los Angeles Rams can defeat the seven-time Super Bowl Champion Tom Brady in Tampa. Then they're joined by the legendary Michael Buffer and he shares where: 'Let's Get Ready to Rumble' came from and why Najee Harris is his favorite angry runner; they're joined by CJ Uzomah and he talks about his first playoff win, the Ickey Shuffle, and how they're preparing for the Titans; they're joined by AJ Hawk and he shares his thoughts on the Packers - 49ers matchup and why Aaron Rodgers deserves the MVP; and lastly, they're joined by Ryan Leaf and he shares his thoughts on why he has his eyes on Joe Burrow and the Bengals this weekend and why Matthew Stafford has the most pressure on him this weekend.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:

Michael thinks Derrick Henry will be a factor with how it affects the Titans game plan. We ask which players have to be dominant this weekend while taking a closer look at Matt Stafford's ability to get past the Buccaneers. Bills and Chiefs is a matchup of two star QB's and will set the stage for years to come in the AFC. After some coaching updates we turn to the NFC looking at the 49ers chances against the Packers. Peter thinks Kyle Shanahan's familiarity with the Packers is going to help San Fran while Michael thinks Aaron Rodgers has some legacy points on the line in this game.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson start the show by examining the Los Angeles Rams blowout win over the Arizona Cardinals on Monday Night Football. Then the crew shares their thoughts on who's the most influential NON-QB left in the playoffs and which ex-player without experience would be an effective head coach. They're joined by Scott Pioli and he shares his thoughts on the Rams - Cardinals game and what needs to change for minorities to be given more opportunities as head coaches; and they finish up with Dan Hanzus and he explains why the Rams are #8 in his Power Rankings and why he has Buffalo ranked over Kansas City.

The Buccaneers made it look easy against the Eagles and Peter thinks Tampa is being overlooked. The Cowboys couldn't complete a comeback against the 49ers and their final play will be questioned the rest of the offseason. All eyes are on Kyler Murray and Matt Stafford tonight in Los Angeles, but Kyle says it's now or never for the Rams QB.

item.title: Tape Heads - Week 18, Episode 1: Raiders run to postseason, Colts and Carson Wentz disappointment, Judging the Giants
item.itunes:title: Tape Heads - Week 18, Episode 1: Raiders run to postseason, Colts and Carson Wentz disappointment, Judging the Giants
item.description:
In the latest episode of the Tape Heads podcast, hosts Dan Orlovsky, Bob Wischusen and Scott Pioli discuss the Raiders almost unbelievable path through this season to the Playoffs. The Colts loss to the Jaguars could be the most disappointing game performance of the season. We look at the upcoming offseason decisions coming for Indianapolis and the future of Carson Wentz. From a disappointing game to a disappointing play call, we examine the Giants and Joe Judge calling for a QB sneak deep in their own territory.

The Tape Heads Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Jalen Hurts vs Tom Brady, Fixing the Texans, Hall of Famer Isaac Bruce, Super Wild Card Weekend Picks and Brightest Stars!
item.itunes:title: Jalen Hurts vs Tom Brady, Fixing the Texans, Hall of Famer Isaac Bruce, Super Wild Card Weekend Picks and Brightest Stars!
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara discuss the Eagles chances against the Buccaneers and how it's an opportunity for Jalen Hurts to start his playoff legacy. The Texans fired David Culley but finding a new head coach isn't the only step needed to fix this franchise, Looking at the NFC, Kyle explains why he's taking the Eagles and Peter, Shaun, and Kay are all taking the 49ers over the Cowboys. Hall of Famer Isaac Bruce stops by to discuss the pressure on the Rams this postseason and the play of Cooper Kupp. We close the week with our Super Wild Card Weekend picks and the players that will be the Brightest Stars in these games.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Can Eagles upset Buccaneers? How can Steelers defeat Chiefs? Likely road team to advance? Pat Freiermuth; Fantasy Awards
item.itunes:title: Can Eagles upset Buccaneers? How can Steelers defeat Chiefs? Likely road team to advance? Pat Freiermuth; Fantasy Awards
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and former NFL running back Maurice Jones-Drew open up exploring if the Philadelphia Eagles have a legitimate chance of upsetting the Super Bowl champion Tampa Bay Buccaneers on the road. Then they share their thoughts on which road team has the best chance for an upset win and how the Pittsburgh Steelers can take down the Kansas City Chiefs. They're joined by Pittsburgh Steelers tight end Pat Freirmuth for his thoughts on the Steelers season and the game between the Chargers and Raiders which controlled their playoff destiny. They finish up with fantasy awards for the season.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Giants fire HC Joe Judge, Travesty in Super Wild Card Weekend? Patriots and Bills rematch, Fantasy Awards, and can Jimmy Garoppolo deliver?
item.itunes:title: Giants fire HC Joe Judge, Travesty in Super Wild Card Weekend? Patriots and Bills rematch, Fantasy Awards, and can Jimmy Garoppolo deliver?
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Fmr Pro Bowl RB Maurice Jones-Drew discuss the Giants deciding to move on from HC Joe Judge and first turning their attention to finding a GM. What kind of person is needed in NY to move the Giants forward quickly? Kay asks which team losing this weekend would be a travesty and how much will the earlier matchups between the Patriots and Bills matter in this installment? We get the first of our Fantasy Football Awards before taking a look at the impact that QB Jimmy Garoppolo will have on the 49ers-Cowboys matchup on Sunday.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and former NFL running back Maurice Jones-Drew start with an examination on just how good this Dallas Cowboys team is. Then they share their thoughts on the most disappointing team this season and the biggest obstacle facing the Kansas City Chiefs. Scott Pioli joins the show and he shares his thoughts on the firing of Brian Flores, the Bills and Patriots matchup, and the Eagles and Buccaneers matchup. They finish up with the 'Taco Bout It' segment and they highlight Derek Carr and the Las Vegas Raiders; the Cincinnati Bengals defense; the Pittsburgh Steelers logo; and the adversity the New Orleans Saints faced this season.

item.title: NFL Playoffs are set, Raiders avoid tie with Chargers, Jaguars send Colts home, Coaching Changes aplenty, and Super Wild Card Weekend Previews
item.itunes:title: NFL Playoffs are set, Raiders avoid tie with Chargers, Jaguars send Colts home, Coaching Changes aplenty, and Super Wild Card Weekend Previews
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara paint the NFL Playoff landscape that finished with the Raiders OT win over the Chargers. Did an unexpected timeout from LA change the Raiders minds about taking a tie? A gut-wrenching loss by the Colts to the Jaguars could have Indy fans questioning Carson Wentz through the offseason. The Bears, Vikings, and Dolphins all start their postseason moves with head coaching changes and more. TJ Watt, Tom Brady and Jimmy Garoppolo get Game Balls for their final regular season games. We also look at the Super Wild Card Weekend games that the crew is looking forward to watching.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Could MVP be decided on Sunday? Week 17 Playoff implications, Fmr Cowboys TE Jason Witten, Nate Burleson, and Pigskin Picks!
item.itunes:title: Could MVP be decided on Sunday? Week 17 Playoff implications, Fmr Cowboys TE Jason Witten, Nate Burleson, and Pigskin Picks!
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Hall of Famer Cris Carter debate the current MVP candidates and which ones could surge ahead this Sunday. The crew looks at the games in Week 17 that have playoff implications. 11x Pro Bowl TE Jason Witten talks about his jump into coaching and his expectations for the Cowboys and Raiders in the playoffs. Kay gives her Top Five Fantasy players based on who still has something to play for this weekend. Nate Burleson makes his regular Friday appearance and discusses Aaron Rodgers and Cooper Kupp's MVP chances and the amazing season of Ja'Marr Chase. We wrap up with the final Pigskin Picks for the NFL Regular season.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Hall of Famer Cris Carter explore the tension between Green Bay Packers quarterback, Aaron Rodgers, and the MVP voters. Then they discuss how the San Francisco 49ers can defeat the Los Angeles Rams; Cris Carter explains why Ja'Marr Chase has been a better rookie wide receiver than Randy Moss; and lastly, they're joined by NBC's Cris Collinsworth for his thoughts on Joe Burrow, Ja'Marr Chase and the Cincinnati Bengals.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Dangerous Playoffs teams, Belichick laughing, Raiders-Chargers rivalry, Bills HC Sean McDermott, Rams facing 49ers, and Dolphins DB Jason McCourty
item.itunes:title: Dangerous Playoffs teams, Belichick laughing, Raiders-Chargers rivalry, Bills HC Sean McDermott, Rams facing 49ers, and Dolphins DB Jason McCourty
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Hall of Famer Cris Carter start looking at playoff contenders and ask if the Cowboys or Eagles would be more dangerous in the postseason. Kyle doesn't trust the Cowboys and thinks the Eagles know who they are. The crew tries to figure out what Bill Belichick said to make everyone on his team laugh. The Chargers and Raiders close out the regular season on Sunday Night but could a tie benefit both teams? Bills HC Sean McDermott drops by to talk about his chance to close out the AFC East. Meanwhile, the Rams have the NFC West on the line as they face the 49ers, who could be without Jimmy Garoppolo. Dolphins DB Jason McCourty joins us for an update on his injury and a look at Miami's future.


The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Hall of Famer Cris Carter react to Ben Roethlisberger's final game in Pittsburgh on Monday Night Football and they also reflect on Big Ben's hall of fame career. Then the panel debates if the New England Patriots or the Cincinnati Bengals are the bigger playoff threat; and they're joined by Scott Pioli and he shares his thoughts on Big Ben, the Eagles, and playoff runs with young quarterbacks without playoff experience, Lastly, they're joined by Quinnen Williams and he shares why he gives back to the community and how the New York Jets are getting better through mistakes and experience.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Packers clinch NFC, Buccaneers win despite AB mutiny, Bengals Impressive win over Chiefs, Cris Carter and Nate Burleson, plus a MNF preview!
item.itunes:title: Packers clinch NFC, Buccaneers win despite AB mutiny, Bengals Impressive win over Chiefs, Cris Carter and Nate Burleson, plus a MNF preview!
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Hall of Famer Cris Carter dive into 2022 with the Packers clinching home field advantage through the playoffs. Kyle questions if Lambeau is such a huge advantage, but believes the bye week is far more important. The Bucs comeback win is overshadowed by Antonio Brown's 3rd quarter exit from the field and team, but Cris thinks the situation is disappointing because Brown looks like a person in crisis and could need serious help. The Bengals clinched the AFC North and look like they could beat any time. Cris Carter weighs in on the AB situation with the Bucs, plus we get a MNF preview of Browns-Steelers.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Tales from the Vault: Hall of Fame QB Brett Favre (1996)
item.itunes:title: Tales from the Vault: Hall of Fame QB Brett Favre (1996)
item.description:
Host Andrea Kremer takes us back to 1996 when NFL Films' Steve Sabol interviewed Quarterback Brett Favre in Mississippi. The conversation starts with a warning from Brett to watch out for snakes along the dock of Rotten Bayou. Brett recalls growing up and playing for his Dad before heading to Southern Miss, where he was involved in a serious car accident before the start of his Senior season. Now in the NFL and coming off his first MVP season, Brett tells Steve about his tough relationships with head coaches Jerry Glanville and Mike Holmgren. Steve discusses Brett's Super Bowl dreams before asking him a few questions that you'll have to hear to believe.

The Tales from the Vault podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson look at the growing playoff picture and the important games coming into Week 17. The Dolphins look to continue their winning streak to move closer to a wildcard spot, but they've got a tough matchup against the Titans. Chiefs-Bengals could be the matchup of the week and Peter is expecting an old-school shootout. We get an update on the futures of Ben Roethlisberger and Russell Wilson, plus the Cardinals hope to get some 'juice' back against the Cowboys but Kyler Murray isn't worried. We wrap up 2021 with the Pigskin Picks for NFL Week 17. Happy New Year from GMFB!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Tom Pelissero, and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson debate which NFL team is the most intimidating with the playoffs right around the corner. Then the crew discusses if Lamar Jackson's potential return will be enough to get the Baltimore Ravens into the playoffs; they also dive into how MVP voting works and if Aaron Rodgers deserves the award. They finish up sharing which players need a refresh to close out the regular-season and they're joined by Green Bay Packers, nose tackle, Kenny Clark, and he shares his thoughts on his pro bowl season and what's different about Aaron Rodgers this season.

item.title: Remembering NFL Legend John Madden, Commissioner Roger Goodell, Melissa Stark, and Andrea Kremer share memories of Madden
item.itunes:title: Remembering NFL Legend John Madden, Commissioner Roger Goodell, Melissa Stark, and Andrea Kremer share memories of Madden
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson honor and remember the life and legend of John Madden. While there are plenty of emotions, it's also a celebration of his lifelong impact on the NFL. Commissioner Roger Goodell joins the show to reflect on recent conversations he had with Madden as well as time spent on the Madden cruiser over the years. Kyle fondly remembers the Madden commercials and why as a child, he believed that he should want to have athlete's foot. Melissa Stark shares her memories of working with Madden on Monday Night Football and Andrea Kremer tells the crew about launching Sunday Night Football with Madden and the meaningful calls and advice Coach gave to Andrea before calling her first game.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Peter Schrager, Kyle Brandt and Super Bowl Champion, Mike Robinson explore which wild card team in the AFC (Chargers, Patriots, Dolphins, Colts) is the most dangerous. Then Peter leads "we in or we out" and the crew debates if Mike Vrabel or somebody else should be the coach of the year, and how similar Joe Burrow looks to Macaulay Culkin. Also, they're joined by Scott Pioli and he shares his thoughts on the legitimacy of the Dallas Cowboys and how a team decides if they have their quarterback of the future and lastly, they're joined by Hall of Famer, Aeneas Williams, and he touches on the current state of the Los Angeles Rams and Arizona Cardinals and who he thinks is the toughest receiver to guard in the NFL right now.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.content:encoded:

Then Peter leads "we in or we out" and the crew debates if Mike Vrabel or somebody else should be the coach of the year, and how similar Joe Burrow looks to Macaulay Culkin. Also, they're joined by Scott Pioli and he shares his thoughts on the legitimacy of the Dallas Cowboys and how a team decides if they have their quarterback of the future and lastly, they're joined by Hall of Famer, Aeneas Williams, and he touches on the current state of the Los Angeles Rams and Arizona Cardinals and who he thinks is the toughest receiver to guard in the NFL right now.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Cowboys rout WFT, Bills bounce back against Patriots, Nate Burleson, Game Balls and a MNF Preview!
item.itunes:title: Cowboys rout WFT, Bills bounce back against Patriots, Nate Burleson, Game Balls and a MNF Preview!
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, Tom Pelissero and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson are impressed by the Cowboys offense and defense coming together in a rout of the WFT. The Chiefs clinched their Division title while the Bills took a step closer with a win over the Patriots. The crew gives their thoughts on Joe Burrow carrying the Bengals with over 500 passing yards and scoring 82 points in his last two games. Week 16 left GMFB with plenty of Head Scratchers and Game Balls to deliver with Nate Burleson, plus our former co-host started a new family holiday tradition that he describes. We wrap up the Monday show with a preview of Dolphins-Saints coming up tonight on MNF.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Eagles run past WFT, Rams roll past Seahawks, Week 16 expectations, SB Champ Torrey Smith and Fmr RB Eddie George
item.itunes:title: Eagles run past WFT, Rams roll past Seahawks, Week 16 expectations, SB Champ Torrey Smith and Fmr RB Eddie George
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Aqib Talib break down the two NFL games from Tuesday night. Peter thinks the Eagles could be a threat, if they make the playoffs while the Rams win over the Seahawks ensures Russell Wilson will have his first losing season since becoming Seattle's QB in 2012. The crew asks and explores which player will need to have a special performance in Week 16 while Kay answers some Fantasy Football questions and reveals the worst present she's ever gotten. 2x Super Bowl Champion Torrey Smith drops by to discuss the Ravens and who is the best WR in the game. Plus, Fmr NFL RB Eddie George tells us about the Titans, the chance of RB Jonathan Taylor winning the MVP, and his first season as Head Coach for Tennessee State Football.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: Urban Meyer Fired after 13 games; Chargers vs. Chiefs; DeAndre Hopkins OUT; Best QB matchups; Nate Burleson
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Rachel Bonnetta, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion, Shaun O'Hara, open up the show reacting to the overnight breaking news that Urban Meyer is out in Jacksonville after only 13 games. Then they preview the intense Thursday Night Football matchup between division opponents, the Los Angeles Chargers and Kansas City Chiefs; they examine how the Arizona Cardinals can fight through the DeAndre Hopkins injury which will have him out for the rest of the regular season; they share which quarterback matchup they're most looking forward to watching this weekend; they're joined by Zach Orth and Tim Jarocky, who were responsible for getting the balls from Tom Brady's 600th and 700th touchdown passes and lastly, they're joined by Nate Burleson.

item.title: Mayfield and Stefanski Breaking News, Chiefs and Chargers on TNF, Advantages in Patriots-Colts, plus can the Packers hold the NFC lead?
item.itunes:title: Mayfield and Stefanski Breaking News, Chiefs and Chargers on TNF, Advantages in Patriots-Colts, plus can the Packers hold the NFC lead?
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Guest Co-host/Actor Brian Baumgartner start the show with breaking news from Will Selva on the positive COVID tests from Browns HC Kevin Stefanski and QB Baker Mayfield. The Chiefs and Chargers kick off Week 15, so the crew looks at which team is playing better right now as well as who will be the player duo to shine. The crew differs on who has the edge between the Patriots and Colts, plus as a Packers fan, Brian doesn't understand how the NFC isn't the Packers to lose at this point.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.itunes:title: Aaron Rodgers still owns Bears, Cowboys defense leads the way, Nate Burleson Game Balls, and MNF Preview!
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara discuss Aaron Rodgers continued ownership of the Bears rivalry as well as updating the QB's toe injury and MVP candidacy. The Bucs held off the Bills, but what does the crew think about Buffalo heading into the playoffs? Micah Parsons and the Dallas defense carried the Cowboys past Washington. Dak Prescott is struggling and Shaun thinks it's time the coaches eliminate opportunities for bad decisions. Nate Burleson drops by giving his Espresso Moment and a Game Ball, but how is Kyle's selection an Operations person from the Buccaneers? We wrap up with a Rams-Cardinals preview of what to expect tonight on Monday Night Football.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.itunes:title: The Heartbreak Team; Jerry Jones talks; Best weekend matchup; Jason Cabinda; Alan Faneca
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and former Pro Bowl RB Maurice Jones-Drew start the Thursday Night Football preview between the Pittsburgh Steelers and Minnesota Vikings by looking at the heartbreaks the Vikings have endured after they lost their 5th game this season on the final play against the Lions. Then they react to Jerry Jones' comments on the mistakes from Dallas Cowboys wide receivers; they share which weekend matchup they're most looking forward to viewing; they're joined by Detroit Lions fullback, Jason Cabinda, and he shares why it means so much to be a nominee for the Walter Payton Man of the Year award; and lastly, they're joined by Hall of Famer, Alan Faneca, and he shares memories of playing in the Super Bowl, his weight loss and marathon journey. and if LSU is on the right track with the hiring of Brian Kelly.

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Kurt Warner start the show sharing what they learned from the New England Patriots and Buffalo Bills after the Patriots won, despite only throwing the ball three times on Monday Night Football. Next, they list off names who are in the running for MVP and discuss if TJ Watt should be considered for the award; then they're joined by Peyton Manning and Eli Manning and they share their thoughts on the Walter Payton Man of the Year award and the ManningCast; and lastly, they're joined by Zachary Levi and he shares what it was like to play Kurt Warner in the movie "American Underdog".

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Chiefs still winning, Lions break through, 2 pt conversion questions, Nate Burleson drops by, and a MNF Preview!
item.itunes:title: Chiefs still winning, Lions break through, 2 pt conversion questions, Nate Burleson drops by, and a MNF Preview!
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Kurt Warner look at how the Chiefs still aren't playing their best football but are getting wins. The Lions got their first win of the season and it was worth more than just a game on the field for Dan Campbell and the Michigan community. The Steelers get past the Ravens on a failed two point conversion attempt from Baltimore that will be debated all season long. The crew debates who will be the most intriguing QB down the stretch before Nate Burleson drops by. We wrap up looking ahead to tonight's Patriots-Bills matchup on Monday Night Football.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson dissect the Cowboys win over the Saints on Thursday Night Football with Micah Parsons and Tony Pollard stealing the highlights. The crew looks ahead to the best matchups coming in Week 13 and Kay gives her Top Five Friday Fantasy Football picks. Fmr Pro Bowl Steelers LB Ryan Shazier drops by to discuss his new book and the upcoming Ravens Steelers matchup and Kyle gives a special tribute to Oxford High School student Tate Myre and all the families affected by the Michigan school shooting.

item.itunes:title: Must win for Cowboys? Expectations for Kyler's return? Frank Gore; Drew Pearson
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson start examining the importance of this Thursday Night Football game for the Dallas Cowboys, who've lost 3 of their last 4 games. Then they dive into mixed bag trivia which focuses on college quarterbacks who changed positions in the NFL; they share what they expect from the Arizona Cardinals now that Kyler Murray's returning from injury; and lastly, they're joined by Frank Gore, who reflects on his long NFL career and talks about his prep for his fight with Deron Williams, and Drew Pearson, who talks about his role in 'The Catch' and his hall of fame speech.

item.itunes:title: Cowboys and Saints on TNF, Bills and Patriots fight for AFC, and Steelers want music at practice
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Michael Robinson look ahead to Thursday Night Football between the Cowboys and Saints. Dallas is facing plenty of challenges while the Saints aren't sure who will be their QB. The AFC lead is on the line when the Bills host the Patriots on Monday Night Football. The Steelers have dropped two in a row and WR Chase Claypool is talking about the lack of music when Pittsburgh practices. The crew asks which non-division leader is playing the best right now before Kay answers some 'Which Guy Wednesday' questions for Fantasy Football.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.itunes:title: Ravens win ugly, Buccaneers ruling NFC, Chargers, Rams and Titans all struggle, Nate Burleson, Game Balls and MNF Preview!
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Fmr NFL FB Michael Robinson start with the Ravens ugly win over the Browns and why Kyle would be very nervous as a Baltimore fan. The Buccaneers keep showing us why they could be the best team in the NFC. Meanwhile, the Titans, Chargers, and Rams continue to have issues. Nate Burleson drops by to give his Espresso Moment and his Game Ball of the Week. The crew hands out their own awards before previewing the Seahawks-Washington Football team matchup on Monday Night Football. While looking at the Seahawks, there are questions whether the team would stick with Pete Carroll or Russell Wilson in the future.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Introducing - NFL Films: Tales From The Vault
item.itunes:title: Introducing - NFL Films: Tales From The Vault
item.description:
NFL Films Tales from the Vault is a weekly podcast that takes you on a deep dive into NFL History. Season 1 features Conversations with Steve Sabol. These full-length interviews between the Hall of Fame former Head of NFL Films and some of the game’s all-time legends have never before been heard in their entirety. Season 1 will include Steve’s conversations with Andy Reid, Brett Favre, Troy Aikman and many more. Host Andrea Kremer, who began her career as a producer at NFL Films, will provide context and insight into these all-time NFL time capsule conversations.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Stuffed from Thanksgiving Football, Too many penalties in Dallas? Impactful Week 12 matchups, Fantasy and Pigskin Picks!
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara look back at the Thanksgiving Day slate of games. The Bills rolled over the Saints, the Bears outlasted the Lions, and the Raiders got the win over the Cowboys in a game with too many flags thrown. Several games in Week 12 will have impacts on division races. Kay gives the Top Five Fantasy matchups plus we get Pigskin Picks, which includes the top College Football matchup of the weekend!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.itunes:title: Giants fire OC Jason Garrett, Cowboys Owner Jerry Jones on Thanksgiving Day, Bills facing challenges, and Kay's Fantasy Football choices
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Super Bowl Champion Shaun O'Hara dissect the Giants firing OC Jason Garrett and what's next for the offense in New York. Cowboys owner Jerry Jones drops by to discuss The Salvation Army's Red Kettle Campaign kicking off on Thanksgiving Day with the Cowboys hosting the Raiders. The crew thinks the Eagles could be a threat in the NFC East, if they continue the path they're on. We discuss how much the Bills have on the line against the Saints in the last of the Thanksgiving Day games. Plus, Kay makes some Fantasy Football decisions heading into NFL Week 12.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.description:

item.itunes:title: Patriots shutout Falcons, Cowboys-Chiefs Showdown, Nate Burleson, Darius Rucker and Pigskin Picks
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Nate Boyer look at the Patriots 25-0 win over the Falcons. Kyle explains how this Pats team is having fun while being jerks on the field. Cowboys-Chiefs is the matchup of the weekend and means a lot for both teams. Will Ron Rivera have an edge over Cam Newton this weekend in Washington-Panthers? Meanwhile, a run by the Eagles could start this weekend with the Saints. Kay gives you her Top Five Fantasy Football Players heading into Week 11. Nate Boyer gives some long snapping lessons and we get reaction from Nate Burleson. Grammy Award winning Artist Darius Rucker drops by and we get Pigskin Picks!

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Rachel Bonnetta, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Nate Boyer open with their concerns for the Los Angeles Rams after their blowout loss to the San Francisco 49ers on Monday Night Football; then they dive into which team is overcoming more this season - the Green Bay Packers or Tennessee Titans; they're joined by Scott Pioli who shares his thoughts on how the L.A. Rams are built, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers aging roster and Mac Jones development; Rachel Bonnetta gives a fiery motivational speech for the Detroit Lions; then they're joined by Dan Hanzus for his latest edition of Power Rankings; and lastly, Nate Boyer shares his experiences and involvement in the military.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Chiefs back on track? Patriots threatening in the AFC, Rams or Buccaneers in the NFC, Nate Burleson, Game Balls and MNF Preview!
item.itunes:title: Chiefs back on track? Patriots threatening in the AFC, Rams or Buccaneers in the NFC, Nate Burleson, Game Balls and MNF Preview!
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Rachel Bonnetta, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Nate Boyer discuss the Chiefs returning to form against the Raiders. The Patriots blow past the Browns, should the rest of the AFC be concerned that the playoffs could once again run through Foxborough? The Rams could be the best team in the NFC with all their weapons, but Nate feels like the Buccaneers are just playing possum and Rachel is going with the Packers. Nate Burleson drops by before talking to the Original Ghostbusters! The crew hands out Game Balls for NFL Week 10 then prepares us for Monday Night Football between the Rams and 49ers.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.itunes:title: Dolphins surprise the Ravens, OBJ to the Rams, Nate Burleson on Cam Newton and OBJ, Super Bowl Champ Andre Rison and Pigskin Picks!
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager and Nick Mangold discuss the Dolphins surprise upset over the Ravens and Tua Tagovailoa playing while injured. WR Odell Beckham Jr. is headed to the Rams and the crew explains why it's a good fit. Nate Burleson drops by to discuss Cam Newton returning to the Panthers and why he would get in a ring with Mike Tyson. Kay gives her top Fantasy Football picks and we get thoughts on all the top matchups coming in NFL Week 10. Super Bowl Champion WR Andre Rison comments on the Falcons and Chiefs plus a special Pigskin Pick for the 2nd Grade Crimson Tide.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.itunes:title: Odell Beckham Jr. and Browns parting ways, Packers without Aaron Rodgers, Hall of Famer Ed Reed and Nate Burleson, and Pigskin Picks!
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Mike Garafolo and DeAngelo Hall break down a disappointing night for Jets fans with the injury to QB Mike White. We also get breaking news with the Browns soon to be parting ways with Odell Beckham Jr. The Packers will visit the Chiefs this weekend without Aaron Rodgers after he tests positive for COVID. Nate Burleson chimes in on Rodgers and OBJ while we also hear from Hall of Famer Ed Reed on the State of the Ravens. The crew wraps the week with Kay's Top Five Friday and Pigskin Picks for NFL Week 9.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Introducing: Tape Heads
item.itunes:title: Introducing: Tape Heads
item.description:
Tape Heads is a twice-weekly, in-season X-and-O podcast giving fans the “whys and hows” of each week’s NFL action.  

In each episode, Dan, Bob and Scott detail the biggest moments of the NFL weekend based on their study of All-22 coaching footage, aka “The Tape.” Conversations fueled by observation and analysis give fans the new insights and information they crave.

But its coverage extends beyond the surface of real time moments and extends into the living history of the National Football League. With diverse insights from former players and executives – who are also life-long fans and students of the game – Tape Heads also provides historical context for the topics of today, as well as an insider’s view of the current trends within the game.  

Each week, Tape Heads will look back on what we saw in the previous week’s games, and then look ahead to the next week’s matchups using the “tale of the tape” to predict the keys to victory.  

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Packers scary win over Cardinals, Dak Prescott calf injury update, Vikings LB Eric Kendricks, Nate Burleson and NFL Week 8 Pigskin Picks!
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Josh Cribbs open the Halloween weekend with the Packers stunning win over the Cardinals on Thursday Night Football. We discuss the coaching job done by Matt LaFleur and what could've been for Kyler Murray. The crew updates Dak Prescott's injury and we hear from Jameis Winston on facing the team that drafted him #1 overall in 2015. Nate Burleson drops by to discuss some of his Halloween favorites and Vikings LB Eric Kendricks looks ahead to his matchup with the Cowboys. Plus, the best matchups in NFL Week 8 and Pigskin Picks.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Are Saints playoff worthy? Is Matt Ryan underrated? Are the Bengals for real? Power Rankings; Damien Harris
item.itunes:title: Are Saints playoff worthy? Is Matt Ryan underrated? Are the Bengals for real? Power Rankings; Damien Harris
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Shaun O'Hara open up breaking down the New Orleans Saints big time road win over the Seattle Seahawks on Monday Night Football and they discuss if the Saints are a true threat at making the playoffs in the NFC. Then the crew explores just how good of quarterback Matt Ryan is and if it's too early to question the Trey Lance selection; Scott Pioli joins the show and shares if this Cincinnati Bengals team is for real; Dan Hanzus joins the show and talks about his controversial power rankings; and lastly, New England running back Damien Harris joins the show and shares how similar and different Bill Belichick and Nick Saban are as head coaches and how impressive Mac Jones has been in his rookie season.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:

Then the crew explores just how good of quarterback Matt Ryan is and if it's too early to question the Trey Lance selection; Scott Pioli joins the show and shares if this Cincinnati Bengals team is for real; Dan Hanzus joins the show and talks about his controversial power rankings; and lastly, New England running back Damien Harris joins the show and shares how similar and different Bill Belichick and Nick Saban are as head coaches and how impressive Mac Jones has been in his rookie season.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Tom Brady's 600th career TD, Titans roll the Chiefs, Joe Burrow statement win, Game Balls, and MNF Preview
item.itunes:title: Tom Brady's 600th career TD, Titans roll the Chiefs, Joe Burrow statement win, Game Balls, and MNF Preview
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and Shaun O'Hara were amazed by the bad weather performance of Colts QB Carson Wentz in a victory over the 49ers. Bengals QB Joe Burrow notched his first win over the Ravens. Credit the Titans for routing the Chiefs but there's concern for Patrick Mahomes after taking a big hit. The NFL Trade deadline is just over a week away, so we update the status of QB Deshaun Watson. Nate Burleson drops by to talk Tom Brady's 600th TD pass and a fan giving it back? Kyle gives his Game Ball to Bengals HC Zac Taylor and we preview MNF between the Saints and Seahawks.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.itunes:title: Browns and Chargers light up scoreboard, Bills revenge win over Chiefs, Barkley and Burrow Injury Updates, Week 5 Game Balls
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt, Peter Schrager, and DeAngelo Hall explain why the Chiefs are no longer the front running team in the AFC while Browns-Chargers could've been the game of the year. Over in the NFC, the Cardinals and Cowboys continue to stake their claims as the best teams in the Conference. Tom Brady should always get a Game Ball, but Josh Allen and Austin Ekeler stepped up this week. We also get injury updates on Saquon Barkley and Joe Burrow looking ahead to Week 6.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, DeAngelo Hall, Peter Schrager and Kyle Brandt discuss comments by Tony Romo being impressed by New York Jets quarterback Zach Wilson. The crew breaks down the biggest Week 1 matchups and latest news, including how Aaron Rodgers and the Green Bay Packers are preparing to face off against the New Orleans Saints and quarterback Jameis Winston. Peter Schrager also gives his best top 5 stories of little-known players making 53-man rosters after cutdown days. Buffalo Bills linebacker Devin Singletary also joins the show for an interview with Kay, DeAngelo, Peter and Kyle. NFL Media's Will Selva has the lastest news and the hosts chat about the Philadelphia Eagles reunion of head coach Nick Sirianni and quarterback Gardner Minshew.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Patriots QB Analysis, Young QBs Wake Up Calls, Players with Biggest Chips on Their Shoulders, International Players, Fantasy Mock Drafts
item.itunes:title: Patriots QB Analysis, Young QBs Wake Up Calls, Players with Biggest Chips on Their Shoulders, International Players, Fantasy Mock Drafts
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, DeAngelo Hall, Peter Schrager and Kyle Brandt break down the latest news of the New England Patriots quarterback competition and which other young QBs from around the NFL will have a wake up call in Week 1. Baltimore Ravens center Bradley Bozeman also joins the show for an interview with Kay, DeAngelo Peter and Kyle. The crew discusses which players in the NFL have the biggest chips on their shoulders heading into the season. Former New England Patriots, Kansas City Chiefs and Atlanta Falcons executive Scott Pioli joins the show to discuss the NFL's International Player Pathway Program and more. The hosts tackle the latest news of the day and rundown some of the best fantasy football scenarios ahead of the season.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: AFC Quarterback Shakeups, Cutdown Days, Roster Moves, Rookie Risers, Doug Williams Interview, Breakout Players
item.itunes:title: AFC Quarterback Shakeups, Cutdown Days, Roster Moves, Rookie Risers, Doug Williams Interview, Breakout Players
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, DeAngelo Hall, Peter Schrager and Kyle Brandt break down how confident the Houston Texans are with quarterback Deshaun Watson and the Miami Dolphins with their young quarterback, Tua Tagovailoa in addition to New York Jets rookie quarterback Zach Wilson. The crew also discusses how practices change and what the feeling is like on cutdown day. Super Bowl XXII MVP Doug Williams joins the show for a live interview with Kay, DeAngelo, Peter and Kyle. The hosts also bring you up to date with the breaking news of the New England Patriots releasing quarterback Cam Newton. On the show, the crew makes their final rookie riser rankings of the preseason and Peter Schrager updates his list of the Top 10 breakout players ahead of the 2021 season.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Daniel Jones vs. Mac Jones, Best Fantasy RBs, Biggest News Ahead of Week 1, More Young QB Battles
item.itunes:title: Daniel Jones vs. Mac Jones, Best Fantasy RBs, Biggest News Ahead of Week 1, More Young QB Battles
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, DeAngelo Hall, Peter Schrager and Kyle Brandt break down the best highlights from Week 3 of the NFL preseason ahead of the regular season openers. The crew discusses how young quarterbacks fighting for the starting spot fared in Week 1, including New York Giants quarterback Daniel Jones, New England Patriots quarterback Mac Jones, Trevor Lawrence of the Jacksonville Jaguars and the San Francisco 49ers quarterback competition between Jimmy Garoppolo and Trey Lance. The hosts tackle a range of topics including the best running backs to draft in fantasy football this season and the biggest headlines and news across the league.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: NFC East MVP, NFL's Best Triplets, Aaron Rodgers, Interviews with Calvin Johnson, Deion Branch
item.itunes:title: NFC East MVP, NFL's Best Triplets, Aaron Rodgers, Interviews with Calvin Johnson, Deion Branch
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Peter Schrager and Kyle Brandt go down memory lane during Nate Burleson's final show. The crew break down who is more valuable to their NFC East teams, Saquon Barkley to the New York Giants or Dak Prescott for the Dallas Cowboys. Hall of Fame wide receiver Calvin Johnson and Super Bowl MVP Deion Branch join the show for live interviews with Kay, Nate, Peter and Kyle. The crew previews the biggest matchups ahead of the final week of preseason games, including what to expect from Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes against the Minnesota Vikings and Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers against the Buffalo Bills. The hosts tackle a range of topics including the which set of NFL triple threats will be the most exciting to watch during the 2021 NFL season.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Mac Jones vs. Cam Newton, Preseason Week 3 Preview, Opening Day Starting Quarterbacks, Melissa Etheridge, Younghoe Koo Interviews
item.itunes:title: Mac Jones vs. Cam Newton, Preseason Week 3 Preview, Opening Day Starting Quarterbacks, Melissa Etheridge, Younghoe Koo Interviews
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Nate Burleson, Peter Schrager and Kyle Brandt break down the league's top quarterback battles as Mac Jones and Cam Newton of the New England Patriots Jimmy Garoppolo and Trey Lance of the San Francisco 49ers fight to be named the opening day starters. The crew also discusses the position battle winners such as QB Teddy Bridgewater with the Denver Broncos Trevor Lawrence with the Jacksonville Jaguars. Atlanta Falcons kicker Younghoe Koo and Academy Award and Grammy Award winning musician Melissa Etheridge joins the show for a live interview with Kay, Nate, Peter and Kyle. The crew previews the biggest matchups ahead of the final week of preseason games. The hosts tackle a range of topics including the biggest news headlines from around the NFL and which players need to make the biggest impact in the final preseason games.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.title: Disrespect for Lamar Jackson, Bears/Eagles Quarterback Battle, Patriots Offensive Shakeup, Randy Moss Joins the Show
item.itunes:title: Disrespect for Lamar Jackson, Bears/Eagles Quarterback Battle, Patriots Offensive Shakeup, Randy Moss Joins the Show
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Nate Burleson, Peter Schrager and Kyle Brandt break down the expectations and changes for the Baltimore Ravens offense and quarterback Lamar Jackson. Next, former Minnesota Vikings wide receiver Randy Moss brings his Hall of Fame expertise to the show for a live interview with Kay, Nate, Peter and Kyle. Later, the crew previews the biggest matchups ahead of the final week of preseason games. The hosts tackle a range of topics including the quarterback position battles of the Chicago Bears and Philadelphia Eagles with their respective young quarterbacks, Justin Fields and Jalen Hurts and which changes will have the biggest impact on the New England Patriots quarterback and running back positions.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Saints Quarterback Competition, Rookie Risers, Ranking Top Fantasy Players
item.itunes:title: Saints Quarterback Competition, Rookie Risers, Ranking Top Fantasy Players
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Nate Burleson, Peter Schrager and Kyle Brandt break down the New Orleans Saints quarterback competition, discussing whether Jaemis Winston or Taysom Hill is best fit to start at QB. Next, the crew discusses the Saints Monday Night Football game against quarterback Trevor Lawrence and the Jacksonville Jaguars. The hosts tackle a range of topics including which NFL rookies have made the biggest impact during the preseason. Later, the crew interviews former New England Patriots, Kansas City Chiefs and Atlanta Falcons executive Scott Pioli and discuss how teams determine how much playing time to dedicate to their starters, veterans, rookies and players on the roster bubble during the final preseason game. Also in the episode, Kay, Nate, Peter and Kyle help fantasy owners get ready for their drafts by ranking the biggest fantasy stars at the most important positions.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: Best Baller Bling, Top 100 Players Reactions, Rookie Patience vs. Hype and Records Most Likely to Fall
item.description:
In the latest edition of the Good Morning Football Podcast, hosts Kay Adams, Nate Burleson, Peter Schrager and Kyle Brandt break down the biggest trends from Week 2 of the NFL preseason. The hosts discuss a range of game topics including which players showed off the best bling over the weekend. Later, the crew discusses which fanbases need to be patient with the development of their young stars and which hype trains are off the rails. Players discussed include Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa and New York Jets quarterback Zach Wilson. Also in the episode, Kay, Nate, Peter and Kyle react to the latest Top 100 list of the best NFL players and look ahead to the 2021 season predicting which iconic records could be broken.

The Good Morning Football Podcast is part of the NFL Podcast Network.

item.itunes:title: Introducing Good Morning Football
item.description:
The best morning show on sports television is now a daily podcast. GMFB sets the narrative and agenda for everything from the NFL Draft to Training Camp to Kickoff. Kay Adams, Peter Schrager, and Kyle Brandt are talking all things football 12 months a year on GMFB. Be sure to catch Good Morning Football on NFL Network weekdays at 7:00 AM ET and Saturdays at 9:00 AM ET.

item.itunes:title: WEDNESDAY 2/24 - Big Ben is expected to return to the Steelers and the franchise tag window opens
item.description:
Ben Roethlisberger is willing to adjust his contract to return to Pittsburgh for the 2021 season. Dallas wants to do a long term deal with Dak Prescott, but is willing to franchise tag him for a second straight year. Super Bowl champion Chris Godwin has a decision to make as free agency approaches. New Falcons general manager Terry Fontenot says all options are on the table with the 4th overall pick in the draft. Bills cornerback Josh Norman gives his thoughts on his future in with or without Buffalo and Alex Smith revealed his return to the starting lineup "threw a wrench" in the teams plans.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: MONDAY 2/8 - Super Bowl LV recap and remembering Chris Wesseling
item.itunes:title: MONDAY 2/8 - Super Bowl LV recap and remembering Chris Wesseling
item.description:
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Tom Brady made Super Bowl history defeating the Kansas City Chiefs 31-9 (0:07)... Tom Brady capturing his 7th Lombardi Trophy as Tampa Bay won its second title in franchise history. Wide Receiver Mike Evans saying Brady brought the "LeBron effect" with him to Tampa (2:04). Meanwhile, Patrick Mahomes held without a touchdown pass as the Buccaneers defense caused KC problems all night (2:27). The podcast wraps with a tribute to our late NFL Media colleague Chris Wesseling, who passed away on Friday (3:31). Good Morning Football is part of the NFL Podcasts network.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

Tom Brady making his 10th Super Bowl appearance knows he'll have his hands full with the high-powered Chiefs (0:37), while Andy Reid (2:30) is known to call a trick play or two. Travis Kelce talks about the Chiefs offense needing to be firing on all cylinders to defeat the Bucs (3:24). In non-Super Bowl news, NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell happy we've made it to the big game (4:19). The Eagles getting calls about Carson Wentz (4:50) while Falcons owner Arthur Blank says his two stars aren't going anywhere (5:10)

item.title: THURSDAY 1/28 - Texans tag their man
item.itunes:title: THURSDAY 1/28 - Texans tag their man
item.description:
The final head coaching job has been filled (:07) as David Culley will become the new head coach of the Texans. Speaking of coaches, Bruce Arians looking to become the oldest head coach to ever win a Super Bowl, but if he does will it be his last? (1:12). Drew Brees' (1:59) future is still up in the air, so what does Saints GM Mickey Loomis plan to do if Brees retires? Plus, we'll take a look at tonight's Monday night matchup (3:41) between the Steelers and Bengals

item.itunes:title: WEDNESDAY - 49ers injury woes and Packers lineup changes 2020
item.description:
Thursday Night Football will see the 49ers and Packers face off, but there will be some familiar faces missing. Quarterback Jimmy Garoppolo (0:23) expected to miss 4-6 weeks with an ankle injury, while tight end George Kittle (0:34) could be placed on Injured Reserve as he deals with a fractured foot. Green Bay's backfield (0:44) will be looking thin as running back's AJ Dillon and Jamaal Williams will miss the game due to COVID-19 concerns. The Cowboys quarterback position (1:46) in flux as Andy Dalton has been placed on the Reserve/COVID-19 list, meaning either Cooper Rush or Garrett Gilbert could get the start Sunday against the Steelers. It was quiet trade deadline (3:57), except for the Dolphins making a pair of moves on offense.

item.itunes:title: What Super Bowl LIII taught us about the Patriots dynasty

The "Good Morning Football" crew starts up the show with their biggest takeaways from the Patriots' Super Bowl LIII victory over the Rams (:36).  The gang then discuss the fallout from New England's sixth championship win, including who the true unsung hero of the Pats dynasty is (5:50), and whether this was Bill Belichick's most impressive performance yet (10:00), Lastly, the GMFB team plays a little "Believe it or Not" and debate who they believe is the best football player of all time (23:56). Be sure to check in every Wednesday to the GMFB podcast! item.title: What the Rams and the Patriots can't forget to pack for Super Bowl LIII
item.itunes:title: What the Rams and the Patriots can't forget to pack for Super Bowl LIII
item.description:
The "Good Morning Football" crew starts up the show with some 'Journalism 101' to determine who shall be declared the winner of Super Bowl Opening Night (:47). The gang then gets into '2-Point Conversing', where Nate Burleson and Peter Schrager agree to disagree on several topics surrounding the big game, including whose appearance in this Super Bowl is more impressive for their age - Tom Brady at 41 or Rams head coach Sean McVay at 33 (4:24), and whether or not another Super Bowl ring should make Julian Edelman a Hall of Famer (6:33). Lastly, former NFL cornerback DeAngelo Hall joins the crew to discuss what the Rams and Patriots each cannot forget to bring to Atlanta to win Super Bowl LIII (11:06). Be sure to check in every Wednesday to the GMFB podcast! Like, share, subscribe!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: What we learned from Championship Weekend
item.itunes:title: What we learned from Championship Weekend
item.description:
The Good Morning Football Crew starts up the show with a recap of the best moments from Championship Weekend (:51) including the Patriots' epic battle over the Chiefs, and the Rams' controversial but well deserved victory over the Saints (5:55). The gang then gets into what they learned from the weekend, such as Kyle Brandt's discovery that this will actually be the rubber match between Sean McVay and Julian Edelman, who previously met in a couple MAC Conference games over 10 years ago (24:35),, and Nate Burleson explains why the Patriots' 4-running back backfield are the '4 Horseman' leading the charge to another Tom Brady Super Bowl (32:47). Lastly, Mike Garafolo joins the crew to teach some 'Journalism 101' to answer some of the tough questions that need answering heading into Super Bowl LIII, such as what will be the greatest weakness for the two remaining teams battling for the Lombardi Trophy? (38:51). Be sure to check in every Wednesday to the GMFB podcast! Like, share, subscribe!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Mack's Finishing Move & Being Short Isn't Bad
item.itunes:title: Mack's Finishing Move & Being Short Isn't Bad
item.description:
The Good Morning Football gang have a lot to discuss following an electrifying Week 11 of action! Kyle sheds light on Khalil Mack’s secret (now not so secret) finishing move that is devastating offensive linemen (:35). Next, Kay tees up a redemption story for the ages, as Bears kicker, Cody Parkey, shakes off a tough performance in route to a sensation outing against the Vikings (3:15), and after, Nate, the Saints and Sean Payton are all in on savageness (5:10). Finally, the crew shares their underappreciated storylines, including – QUIT HATING ON SHORT PEOPLE (11:00) and Adam Vinatieri does the ‘Mo Bamaba’ (16:30)?

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

On Episode 6 of the #GMFB Pod: Nate talks about his experience raising the 12th Man Flag in Seattle (1:02); Peter reluctantly recounts the story of a fan asking for his autograph on the sideline (8:45); Kyle discusses the joy of being a father on Christmas (16:40); the crew gets into the big injuries from over the weekend (18:20); Peter presents the “Prisoner’s Dilemma” that exists in the Lions/Packers game this weekend (25:45); the team highlights the big matchups of Week 17 (38:50); the hosts put forth their New Year’s resolutions (48:15); and to close, Peter presents this week’s "Blind Item" story (55:30).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Good Morning Football Podcast Episode 5
item.itunes:title: Good Morning Football Podcast Episode 5
item.description:
On Episode 5 of the #GMFB Podcast, Peter Schrager discusses his time with the Falcons last weekend (1:27); Nate discusses the value of playoff bonuses and player incentives (9:46); the Raiders making the playoffs for the first time since 2002 (17:14); “4 Things” with producer David Brown (22:01); look ahead to Week 16 (32:46); Nate tells a “Blind Item” story (42:46) and the crew discusses some holiday happenings (45:28).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Good Morning Football Podcast Episode 4
item.itunes:title: Good Morning Football Podcast Episode 4
item.description:
On Episode 4 of the GMFB Podcast, the team talks about the wonders of potty training children (1:43); The Rams moving on from Jeff Fisher (3:29); Play “4 Things” with make-up artist Lauren (15:13); Their one take away from week 14 (25:02); Chat about the new Pro Bowl Dodgeball (33:54) and Preview Week 15 (38:00). Last week’s "QB or NOT the QB" segment with Maury Povich (42:45) is followed by the crew answering your Twitter questions (54:23) and playing “Blind Item” (57:20).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Good Morning Football Podcast Episode 3
item.itunes:title: Good Morning Football Podcast Episode 3
item.description:
On Episode 3 of the GMFB Podcast, the hosts recap their respective weeks (1:13); discuss the Cam Newton dress code violation/suspension (5:45); give some Week 13 Takeaways (16:28); interview GMFB Producer J.B. Kritz (22:25); discuss things they’ve done 201 times in honor of Tom Brady’s record-setting win (44:18); look ahead to the Week 14 slate of games(49:36); and answer you Twitter questions (54:06).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Good Morning Football Podcast Episode 2
item.itunes:title: Good Morning Football Podcast Episode 2
item.description:
On Episode 2 of the GMFB Podcast, the crew discusses how they spent their Thanksgivings (:46); If the Raiders are the team to beat in the AFC (12:42); What AFC teams can play the role of spoiler (19:40); Which teams can challenge the Cowboys in the NFC (28:11); If the Texans should consider other options at QB (38:21). Plus, the team answers some of your Twitter questions, and ends the show with some confessions.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
